Given that all of the information that is required to block fraudulent information was already provided Equifax and was received by Equifax as evidenced by certified mail receipts, they are required to block this information. text: This letter is to inform you that I recently received a copy of my credit report that your company publishes and after reviewing it, I found several items on the report that are inaccurate/no proof that it belongs to the alleged debtor. The accounts in question are listed below. Please send me copies of the documents that you have in your files as of this date that you used to verify the accuracy of the accounts listed below.   Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of this request concerning the accounts that you are reporting in my credit report. Please DO NOT respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified. Send me copies of the documents that you have in your files that were used to verify them. If you do not have any documentation in your files to verify the accuracy of these disputed accounts, then please delete them immediately as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ). By publishing these inaccurate and unverified items on my credit report and distributing them to 3rd parties you are damaging my reputation and credit worthiness.  Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified/no contract accounts must be promptly deleted. Also, in accordance with FCRA regulations, any account that does not bear an original signature on contract stating that the alleged debt holder agrees to pay or verified such debt must be removed immediately. Therefore, if you are unable to provide me with a copy of the verifiable proof that you have on file for each of the accounts listed below within 30 days of receipt of this letter then you must remove these accounts from my credit report. During the verification and validation of accounts, please note that federal law requires that all accounts under review are to be removed from credit reports until validated and verified. In accordance with federal guidelines on debt collection practices, verifiable proof would be a signed contract ( bearing original print signature ; excludes electronic signature ) between alleged debtor and creditor reporting an account to the credit repository. If no such contract exists, then by federal law the CRA is require under FCRA to remove the account ( s ). Failure to abide by federal guidelines could result in government sanctions, punitive damages being paid to alleged debtor. As a CRA, it is your responsibility to verify validity and accuracy of items reported. The CRA is has 30 days to verify and provide documented proof to alleged debtor. Please also provide your bonding agent should legal recourse in this matter be necessary.  Please provide me with a copy of an updated and corrected credit report showing these items removed, I demand the following accounts be properly verified or removed immediately.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: On XXXX XXXX, 2017 I personally found out that my identity may have been compromised. Equifax did not properly secure my protected personal information from intrusion, such as through appropriate patching, 2-factor authentication at the point of service, segmentation of data, etc. As such, it appears my full name, Social Security numbers, birth date, addresses, and possibly driver license number is cross-matched to each other and in the hands of criminals who can use this data to breach any number of accounts in perpetuity such as my banking and financial data, medical data, legal complaints, political data, and any other number of sensitive accounts.  Further, I am unable to secure these accounts because they ask for the very personal information that is breached in order to verify my identity and approve a change.  Equifax is currently offering a limited credit monitoring service, which does n't even activate immediately. Even this had to be sought out by those who see the news reports, follow the news links to the Equifax page, which in turn link to a shady third-party website asking for 2/3 of one 's social security number plus last name and a waiver of all class action recourse in order to discover if one is among the breached accounts, only changed to waive class action recourse from the third party site if it too is breached with the sensitive data it is querying once the news of this spread. This is insufficient to the need created by their negligent protection of my information, which I did not give them myself, but which they curated as their business from other businesses.

text: Good day, After discovering UNSOLITICED inquires on my credit record, I sent the following email to XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX.   To Whom it may concern, I was just reviewing my credit when I noticed an inquiry from " XXXX XXXX ''. Why PRECISELY are you inquiring about my credit??? I didnt authorize ANY action of this nature, yet it is clearly and negatively affecting the status of my credit. If you do not remove it and/or contact all three credit reporting agencies and ensure its removed entirely AND explaining this was done in error, you will be on the losing side of a VERY expensive lawsuit. I NEVER instigated this action, so its in YOUR best interests to see it removed from my credit history IMMEDIATELY. Capiche?    XXXX XXXX -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- - They replied the following day with this : Good morning, Thank you for reaching out regarding this issue. XXXX is defined by the Fair Credit Reporting Act as a reseller of credit information, and we provide credit reporting services most commonly to our mortgage company clients.   Please be advised that XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  have all become part of a larger company, XXXX  XXXX. We provide this information to explain why this response may appear to come from a company other than the company that you contacted.   We would be happy to provide the name of the company that pulled your credit ; however, additional information is needed. Please provide your name, address and date of birth, and the name our company is listed in your records, if known. With this we hope to locate your information in our system. Our apologies for any inconvenience on this issue.  -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- In response, I sent the following the same day : Please provide the name of the company that pulled my credit info. I have supplied the information you requested in order to do so below. According to my credit report, it was " XXXX XXXX  '' who pulled my credit information.   XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX _____________________ As of today 's date, XXXX  has failed to respond. HOWEVER ... XXXX  instigated ANOTHER UNSOLICITED credit inquiry the following day ( XX/XX/XXXX )!   I am a XXXX veteran who's worked diligently to maintain a good credit rating. These entities ( XXXX XXXX and XXXX ) have damaged my credit by requesting completely UNSOLICITED inquiries. PLEASE do everything possible/necessary to convey to them that this behavior will NOT be tolerated.   Very Respectfully, XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX

text: XXXX I paid off {$160000.00} from my Citi credit card so that I could qualify for a mortgage. Citi last reported my balance on XXXX so I expected this to be updated and my credit score reflect this large payoff by XXXX.   I contacted Citi XXXX, they stated it should have updated within 7-10 days which was their normal timeframe. This rep could not tell us why a payoff 3 weeks earlier did not reflect after that much time and hung up on us. I called back and was told its actually going to update when our biling cycle closed out XXXX at midnight so to wait until the next morning. No change the next day, called a third time and spoke to several members of management. Citi now states that they take a full 30 days from my statement date to report new balances to the credit bureaus, so they are single handedly preventing me from getting a mortgage because they will not report my new balance until XXXX. Not to mention the first 2 reps lied to us. All other cards I paid off such as XXXX XXXX, cXXXX, home depot reported payoffs within 1-2 weeks of XXXX.   Why is Citi allowed to take my money immediately but it takes up to 59 days for them to correct their information with the credit bureaus and allow me to move forward with getting a place to live? They should have to pay for every day I have to stay in a motel or in my car.   I was told they sent a dispute report today but they gave a turnaround of another 8 days. I am just hoping that by reaching out to a regulatory agency that you can help me avoid being XXXX and possibly have Citi adjust their policy of taking so much longer than all other card companies I've worked with to do the right thing.   Best, XXXX XXXX
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: I am a victim of identity theft. I have tried, to no avail, to dispute my fraudulent accounts to Equifax. text: On XX/XX/18 I applied for a XXXX card ( pre-approved ). During the application process, there was a disclaimer stating that applying for the card would be subject to approval and that doing so would NOT impact my credit score. I was asked for only the last 4 of my SSN, and as a prior XXXX XXXX member, the disclaimer seemed legitimate. However, I found out that XXXX did a hard inquiry on my Equifax credit report. I did not agree to this. If I had known about the hard inquiry, I would have thought twice before applying. The " will not impact credit score '' disclaimer is completely false.   On XX/XX/18 I contacted Equifax and opened a dispute ; however, I was told this wouldn't do anything since it was not an inquiry due to fraud. Equifax instructed me to contact XXXX. I contacted XXXX/XXXX  and they said they couldn't do anything about it. After I pressed for a credit resolutions department, XXXX/XXXX provided me a XXXX XXXX for their Credit Risk department. I mailed a letter requesting they remove the hard inquiry as they had an inaccurate disclaimer on their website. I also stated I would be filing a CFPB complaint as this disclaimer during the application process is completely misleading.   Unfortunately, I did not think I needed a screenshot before hitting " submit '' on my application. I submitted my application in good faith, trusting that the statements on the application were true and accurate. I don't think it's fair that XXXX/XXXX misleads its consumers, negatively impacting my credit rating in the process.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: Kay Jewelers is in violation of the Truth and Lending Act 162 15 U.S.C. 1666a Regulation of Credit reports, and Truth and Lending Act 163 15 U.S.C. 1666b Timing of Payments. Kay Jewelers is reporting a 30 day missed payment on my credit report. Truth and Lending Act 162 15 U.S.C. 1666a Regulation of Credit reports states, " If a creditor receives a further written notice from an obligor that an amount is still in dispute within the time allowed for payment under subsection ( a ) of this section, a creditor may not report to any third party that the amount of the obligor is delinquent because the obligor has failed to pay an amount which he has indicated under section 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) of this title, unless the creditor also reports that the amount is in dispute and, at the same time, notifies the obligor of the name and address of each party to whom the creditor is reporting information concerning the delinquency. '' Truth and Lending Act 163 15 U.S.C. 1666b Timing of Payments states, A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. ''

text: On XXXX XXXX, 2017 I received a reply from Equifax regarding the dispute of inaccurate and unverifiable information contained in the public records section of my credit report. Equifax says the information is verified as accurate. But I 've circled an inaccurate inconsistency that shows a different address than the address on the tradeline.   The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) states that ONLY 100 % accurate, 100 % complete and 100 %  verifiable information can be reported.   However, they have continued to violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act by reporting inaccurate and unverifiable information in my credit report ... as well as also neglecting to show that the contested information is " currently being investigated '' or as " consumer disputes ''. And this is a very important right that they have blatantly violated EVERY TIME that I 've disputed this information, because they never make that notation & also continue scoring this inaccurate information against me while it 's being investigated ( which is a laughable fraud in and of itself ). Equifax thumbs its nose at federal laws!   Additionally, Equifax has NEVER verified the public records information DIRECTLY with the US Bankruptcy Court. If they had, they would 've discovered that much of what they 're reporting is inaccurate and incomplete.   I have a right to ONLY have this information verified DIRECTLY with the original creditor ... which is the US Bankruptcy Court.   I have also attached a letter from the US Bankruptcy Clerk that states that THEY THINK that credit agencies get their information from a 3rd party service such as XXXX or other agencies like XXXX.   This is not reliable, and is prone to errors.   Equifax has only been relying on the verification of this data from XXXX, which is a DIRECT CONFLICT ... as XXXX sells consumer information to Equifax.   I am demanding that Equifax be reprimanded by the CFPB for their continual violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act & for falsely claiming to have investigated and verified the accuracy of the misreported information ( directly with the US Bankruptcy Court or XXXX County Court ).

text: I 've been a victim of identity theft in the past. I am still recovering from this and have spent thousands to restore my good credit and my good name.   Meanwhile, Equifax, a company which has refused to entertain some of my identity theft claims in the past, now, in an egregious act of fiscal irresponsibility, allowed my identity to be stolen AGAIN.   You ca n't stand against these credit bureaus. They have all the means at their disposal, and they did NOTHING to  safeguard the security of the accounts of millions. Sure. They 're offering a " free '' credit protection as some sort of malarkey recompense, but how reliable is that when it 's being run by the same organization that allowed the private information of millions of customers around the globe to be compromised in the first place?   And these credit bureaus affect your entire LIFE as an average person. They affect your ability to ever buy a home. They affect your ability to get a loan for your new car or for your education. They can even impact your ability to get a job that pays a decent enough wage to have a debt-free life someday! The fact that they have so much responsibility, and were so careless with it, is an egregious breach of consumer protection justice.   Equifax needs to hang up its hat, stop messing with the lives of millions of Americans, issue more than a stupid apology and an enrollment in a free " protection ' company run by the same folks who let our identities be stolen in the first place, and stop ruining the lives of millions with their capricious judgments based on nothing but the whims of greedy bankers. They ruin lives for a living, and then they let hackers ruin even more. They need to be out of business. NOW.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: My debts totaled a bit over {$110000.00} when I entered the program XX/XX/XXXX. The lure of the company ( Harbor Legal Group, or HLG ) was that their program could save me 50 % or more of my debt load. My responsibility was to make regular monthly payments of an amount they calculated, which would pay off my debts at the end of 52 months ( the programs duration ). The 52 monthly paymentspaid without fail month after monthtotaled {$73000.00}. BUT, this {$73000.00} only paid 19 debts that totaled about{$84000.00}, which is about 87 % ( not 50 % ) of those 19 debts and has left me with 8 unpaid debts that total  {$33000.00}! The regaining of a decent credit status I was assured the program would bring me at its completion is unrealized and my credit score is as bad as or worse than at its inception.  I had a total of 27* creditors when I entered the program. The {$73000.00} I paid has settled 19 debts. Eight debts ( almost a third of the total ) have not been settled ; these eight creditors comprise my remaining indebtedness of {$33000.00}. *Another creditor ( a 28th ) seized money from my bank account to settle my debt with them in full before agreeing to a settlement via HLG.   My monthly payments were taken automatically from a personal bank account beginning XX/XX/XXXX. Of the {$73000.00} I paid into the program over 52 months, {$49000.00} went to my creditors. This means that the company itself ( HLG ) netted about {$24000.00} while leaving me with {$33000.00} in unpaid debts.   In a phone conversation XX/XX/XXXX with an HLG representative, I was assured that negotiations would be continuing with the remaining eight creditors and the money I had paid into the program ( {$73000.00} ) would cover those 8 remaining debts. HLG had informed me that they have recordings of all calls on file, so this can be readily verified ( assuming the recording is not edited or erased ). However, in subsequent conversations with HLG representatives this past XXXX, XXXX, I was told that these 8 debts that total {$33000.00} were not covered by what I paid into the program and was therefore my remaining burden. The HLG rep. of XX/XX/XXXX had given me misinformation.

text: REQUEST FOR FREE ANNUAL CREDIT REPORT!!!  I believe that each consumer reporting agency has invalidated the true spirit of the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act. The Act first established XX/XX/2003 was intended to establish a plan whereas common American citizens could obtain a copy of their credit reports at least once a year free of charge. Since each credit reporting agency now has marketing divisions such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  and XXXX  XXXX, the automation system to obtain the free annual reports is looped into an information request to steer citizens into additional product offers that are excessive and unnecessary. Even though I may have received an approval of an updated credit report from either XXXX, XXXX XXXX or Equifax respectively, it is unfair that I need to do a mail request since I can submit my personal information through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. I believe that since the CFPB is the sole responsible oversight party of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, its imperative that any additional solicitation of information from the credit bureaus should be blocked permanently. I along with any other citizen should receive a free credit report upon request. The credit reporting agencies are an important aspect of the national banking system to properly function, but the current aggressive marketing campaign soliciting citizens for an arbitrary FICO score has gone too far, including but not limited to XXXX  XXXX. We must return to a common ground that is fair for all consumers in the United States, and we must be able to request additional marketing on our own terms. Accordingly, I am making a request for a free credit report with confirmation number to my attached email address. Thank you.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: It has come to our attention that TOYOTA MOTOR CREDIT has been demanded us to make payments in error pursuant to 12 CFR 1026.13. Since the inception of the account which is defined under 12 CFR 1002.2 defined as extension of credit and the word account refers only to open-end credit. Open-end credit is defined via Truth in Lending ( 12 CFR 1026.2 ) see below : Open-end credit means consumer credit extended by a creditor under a plan in which ( i ) The creditor reasonably contemplates repeated transactions ; ( ii ) The creditor may impose a finance charge from time to time on an outstanding unpaid balance ; and ( iii ) The amount of credit that may be extended to the consumer during the term of the plan ( up to any limit set by the creditor ) is generally made available to the extent that any outstanding balance is repaid. You have been requiring Federal Reserve notes as payment, when in fact the application with financial information ( social security number ) attached served as an asset, which satisfied the monthly obligation pursuant to 12 CFR 360.6 ( 2 ) as well as self-liquidating paper pursuant to 17 CFR 260.11b-6. This is considered an unauthorized use since I have received NO BENEFIT. This will also serve as notice of breach of fiduciary duty ( U.C.C. 3-307 ). Following this notice if said financial assets are not either returned to the referenced Creditor/Bailor/Beneficiary via mail within Three ( 3 ) business days or accepted for its intended purpose within Three ( 3 ) business days of the receipt of this notice, an SEC complaint will be filed pursuant to 17 CFR 240.15c1-2 and 17 CFR 240.10b-5. As well as an IRS complaint for abusive tax schemes involving the SEC filed trust arrangement.

text: I am requesting to file a complaint against Kia Motors Finance for incorrectly reporting my account as a charge off. I was involved in a car accident in XX/XX/2019, ( which I may include my air bags did not go off ). Following the accident, I received a balance of {$1500.00} in XX/XX/2019, that was still owed for my deductible and miscellaneous issues ( low tire tread, etc ), even though my car was considered a total loss. I did not have {$1500.00} to pay Kia up front, so I contacted them and was told by a representative of Kia, that I would need to pay {$250.00} a month until it was paid off. ( All calls are recorded, which I also requested to pull and listen to ). I had zero issue with that and I agreed to this {$250.00} per month payment and made payments monthly until I paid it completely off on XX/XX/2019.  XX/XX/2019, I received an alert from the Credit Bureau that I had a negative remark on my account. After reviewing the remark and my severally dropped credit score, I noticed Kia had reported my account paid charge off. I was completely shocked considering I made the payments requested every single month. I contacted the Credit Bureau immediately, XXXX, to dispute this remark. I also took time out to write Kia my own dispute via mail on XX/XX/2019, stating that I never have been late on any payment with them, or ANY payments in almost 6 years of credit history. I attached all of the information located on my credit report for XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX as reported ON TIME. They did not report any months as late. Also, the summary of my Kia account stated zero late payments. I requested that Kia report my account as paid off, closed. On XX/XX/2019, I contacted XXXX to get the results of my dispute and was told that Kia stated my account was reported correctly as charge off. On XX/XX/2019, I was alerted of yet another remark of a late payment on my credit report for XX/XX/2019. Kia went back on my credit report and change my ON TIME payment to LATE! I can not believe they changed it, to cover themselves.  Charge offs typically dont happen unless payments are severely late. When you start missing payments, creditors first send letters reminding you of your past-due bill. I never received a past due bill and my account was never sent to collections.  This charge off remark dropped my credit score from a 750+ to XXXX. I have never had derogatory remark on my credit score and always have made my payments on time. Kia is dramatically hurting my credit now and my future. Especially of being a home buyer by inaccurately reporting information incorrectly. If this does not get removed from my credit report, I will be contacting an attorney for future investigation.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: Equifax recently announced a massive data breach. I have used the website they set up to confirm my information was compromised. They have not provided me written notification that my information was compromised, and have not provided details on exactly what information of mine was compromised.   By failing to personally notify my of which data of mine they compromised they are placing the investigative burden on me. They are making me responsible for finding out if they compromised my information.   Once I determined that some of my information had been compromised ( but not details of which information ), the only recourse they offer is one year of " free '' credit monitoring by their service. They are leveraging the problem they created to benefit their business. While they may not have created the situation, it has the appearance of a shakedown scheme.   The risks Equifax has exposed me to are serious. Their response has been anything but. They have failed to provide adequate notification to those they placed at risk and failed to assume responsibility for placing them at risk. I consider this especially egregious since I do not have a consumer relationship of any sort with Equifax ; they store my information for the benefit of themselves and their customers, yet it is me currently facing the risks of their negligence.

(  2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. text: It has come to my attention that both XXXX XXXX and XXXX have been sharing my personal information with the credit reporting agencies without the express written consent. This information includes but is not limited to : transaction history ( late payments ), balance, and experiences. My credit cards are a matter of consumer law.  Pursuan  t to 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( i ) Exclusions report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report. Therefore, late payments and account balance SHOULD NOT appear on my consumer report. Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681 - Congressional findings and statement of purpose, ( a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting The Congress makes the following findings : ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficie ncy of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.  ( 2 ) An elaborate mechanism has been developed for investigating and evaluating the credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, and general reputation of consumers.  ( 3 ) Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers.  ( 4 ) There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy.   The privacy statements provided by both XXXX and XXXX states that my personal information can only be shared with the credit bureau and affiliates. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681a ( w ) The term Bureau means the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection. In addition, pursuant to the U.S. Consumer Privacy Notice provided by XXXX, the term " Affiliates '' means Companies related by common ownership or control. Therefore, the privately held credit reporting agencies would be excluded from being able to use the above mentioned information on my consumer credit report without my express written consent.   I have contacted both XXXX  and XXXX to opt out of all data sharing with any and all third party nonaffiliates, including but not limited to XXXX, XXXX, Equifax, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX

text: On XXXX XXXX, XXXX Equifax admitted they had a breach more than a month prior to XXXX XXXX, XXXX. For 41 days my intellectual property ( IP ) were exposed to and was unaware of potential identity theft during that time. Equifax gathers personal private intellectual data also known as sensitive financial data on consumers payment history then sells that data to banks, insurance companies, potential employers, landlords, and government agencies in the form of consumer credit report. Better known as a credit report as a result of Equifax data breaches. The Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C subsection 1681 ( " FCRA '' ) is U.S. Federal Government legislation enacted to promate the accuracy, fairness, and privacy of consumer information contained in the files of consumer reporting agencies. It was intended to protect consumers from the willful and/or negligent inclusion of inaccurate information in their credit reports. To that end, the FCRA regulates the collection, dissemination, and use of consumer information, including consumer credit information. Together with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( " FDCPA '' ), the FCRA forms the foundation of consumer rights law in the United States. It was originally passed in 1970, and is enforced by the US Federal Trade Commission, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and private litigants.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: I was recently made aware of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX violating my consumer reports when I attempted to apply for an extension of credit. I had absolutely no idea that Thunderbird Collection Specialists had been harming my financial reputation for over a year until I pulled my consumer reports. I have no communication or contract with this company. Nor did I give this company permission to share any information on my consumer report as is required under the FCRA 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ). Thunderbird Collection Specialists has been in business longer than 50 years, there is no excuse for their actions. Brickwedel ( 1882, 62 C. 641 ; Dore v. Southern Pacific Co. ( 1912, 163 C. 182, 124 P. 817 ; People v. Flanagan ( 1924 ), 65 C.A. 268, 223 P. 1014 ; Lincoln v. Superior Court ( 1928 ), 95 C.A. 35, 271 P. 1107 ; San Francisco Realty Co. v. Linnard ( 1929 ), 98 C.A. 33, 276 P. 368. text: Date : XX/XX/XXXX LexisNexis Consumer Center Attn : Escalations XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX To Whom It May Concern : I am disturbed that you continue to list a dismissed ( filed ) bankruptcy as confirmed. I am aware that you receive your information from a third-party verification system known as a pacer system.  This system is sometimes inaccurate because of the limitations of providing a complete Social Security number.  Although it is your policy to keep reporting bankruptcy that is filed, dismissed, or adjudicated for 10 years, the Fair Credit Reporting Act mentions nothing in Section 1681c relating to bankruptcy about dismissals or filings. The law clearly states from " date of adjudication '' or date of " order for relief. '' Any case, civil or otherwise, which is dismissed, no longer exists in the eyes of the law, and a case filed may never have been adjudicated. You have no right to maintain information which the government has deemed non-existent.  It is only fair that in accordance with section 1681 ( a ) ( S ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act you delete this from my credit report and send me an updated copy. text: Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a complaint regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, which I have already sent certified letters to Equifax and XXXX regarding the same issue. Attached to this letter is a copy of my credit report, which highlights the inaccuracies that I have disputed.   I have diligently reviewed my credit report and have identified several errors that are negatively impacting my credit score. Specifically, [ Account XXXX - XXXX Account Holder XXXX - XXXX ] Account XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX - - Account Holder XXXX Account - - XXXX XXXX Account Holder - - XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Holder XXXX - XXXX Current Addresses : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Previous Addresses : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXXXXXX Employer XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I have already submitted disputes to Equifax and XXXX to correct these errors, but they have failed to address my concerns.   I am concerned that these inaccuracies on my credit report will not only affect my credit score but also my ability to secure credit, loans, and other financial products in the future. I am requesting your assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring that my credit report accurately reflects my creditworthiness.   In addition to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which requires credit reporting agencies to provide accurate information to consumers and to investigate and correct any errors, I believe that the following laws also apply to my case : Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : This law regulates the practices of debt collectors and prohibits them from engaging in unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices when attempting to collect debts.  Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) : This law requires credit card issuers to provide consumers with accurate billing statements and to investigate and correct any errors.   Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) : This law prohibits discrimination in credit transactions based on factors such as race, gender, religion, national origin, age, or marital status.   I am hopeful that with your assistance, we can resolve this matter in a timely and satisfactory manner.   Thank you for your time and consideration.   Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Although it is your policy to keep reporting bankruptcy that is filed, dismissed, or adjudicated for 10 years, the Fair Credit Reporting Act does not mention anywhere in Section 1681c relating to bankruptcy about dismissals or filings. text: On XX/XX/XXXX I tried to get my free Equifax annual credit report from the XXXX website. It asked me questions that weren't even close to my credit history, so I answered " None of the above '' to each question. I got a reply that they couldn't confirm my identity and I would have to mail them a hardcopy form, with two pieces of ID. This has actually happened to me every time I've tried to get my free report from Equifax ( I've had no problem getting them from the other two bureaus ). So I filled out the form and included a copy of my Soc Sec card and my drivers license. Then on XX/XX/XXXX, I got a letter from Equifax saying they can't find a credit file in their database with the ID info I gave them, and to further assist me they need additional documents verifying my ID, for example, my Soc Sec card and my drivers license!! I tried calling them at a few different " Customer Service '' numbers. All I got was an automated system that ended up asking me 4 questions that, again, weren't even close to my history. In fact, they might have been the same questions I was asked in my online request. I again answered " None of the above '' to each question. I got a response that, because they can't verify my ID, an agent can't assist me at this time. The end. In XXXX, I had to send a hardcopy request ( as usual ), but I did get my credit report. And it looked OK. That was before their security breach. After the breach, I was able to lock my report without problem. So, they could find me then, apparently, but not now. Because they keep asking me questions not even close to my credit history, it makes me wonder what they've done to/with my credit report information. So, I really would like to get my report from them, to make sure my information is correct.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: I received a notice that there was some suspicious activity on my credit report, so I called the various credit bureaus to freeze my credit and to chase down fraudulent activity. I thought I was calling XXXX and ended up getting this company the Consumer Information Bureau ( their number is exactly the same as XXXX except for the first XXXX numbers ). As I was in the middle of a crazy day at work while also dealing with this, my guard wasnt as high as it typically would be. This company positioned itself as being a partner of XXXX and sold me a service that would monitor my credit, which sounded good in the moment but when I stopped to think about the call after I got off something didnt seem right. So, I started digging and this very much seems like a scam. Im still trying to get a refund ( working with my bank on this at this point ) but now Im additionally worried I may have connected with someone who will try to sell my personal information, which is particularly violating given I was calling after having had my identity stolen as part of a breech.   This company knowingly has picked a phone number close to XXXX  hoping to have consumers in a situation like mine call them so they can take advantage of us in vulnerable moments. As far as I can tell, they dont offer anything beyond what you can do with the credit agencies and theyre charging good money for it. I cant believe I fell for this in the moment and I suspect there are many, many people like me who this has happened to.   At the minimum if this is a legit business, they shouldnt be allowed to have a phone number so similar to XXXX. And if they are not legit as I now suspect, the government should shut them down for fraud.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: the credit bureaus has updated the following accounts on my credit profile but, they have still failed to provide me with an original signed contract with my signature on it. Under the FCRA section 609 & 611. the credit bureaus has violated my consumer rights by not adhering to the law, Section 611 ( S ) ( A ) states you are required to promptly delete all information which can not be verified. The definition of verify, according to the black law dictionary is to confirm or substantiate by oath ; to show to be true. Particularly used of making formal oath to accounts, petitions, pleadings, & other papers. Contract law states that only way to contest an affidavit is to respond another affidavit. According to the black law dictionary an affidavit, a written or a printed declaration or statement of facts, made voluntarily in confirmed by the oath or affirmation of the party making it, taken before an officer having authority to administer such oath. The credit bureaus failed to respond to my previous sworn statement if of dispute affidavit with another sworn statement of dispute affidavit which is against contract law. Also, section 605-B ( a ) block. Except as otherwise provided in the section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any alleged identity thief, not later than 4 business days after the date of the receipt by such agency of- ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity thief report ; furthermore, under the FDCPA section 809 states if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the 30 day period described in subsection ( a ) of this section that the debt, or any portion thereof is disputed, or that the consumer request the name or address of the original predicator, the debt collector shall cease collection of the debt or a copy of a judgement, or name and address of the original creditor, is mailed to the consumer by the debt collection. I am a litigious consumer and fully intend on pursuing litigation in this matter to enforce my rights under the FCRA. If the following accounts and inquiries are not deleted immediately from credit profile. PLEASE IMMEDIATLELY PERMANENETLY DELETE THE FOLOWING ACCOUNTS AND INQUIRIES FROM MY CREDIT PROFILE UNDER THE FCRA SECTION 609, SECTION 605B, SECTION 611, AND FCDPA SECTION 809

text: Under 15 USC 1681 of consumer laws, a company must adhere to certain guidelines when charging off an account and reporting it to the IRS, as well as reporting late payments. If an account has been closed and charged off, and a request for a 1099c was made, the company must comply with the request.  Additionally, if the company has put the account back on the consumer 's credit report without authorization, this may constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Only authorized credit reporting agencies may make such changes to a consumer 's credit report.   In this case, it appears that XXXX and XXXX has acted outside of its authority by putting the account back on the consumer 's credit report. The consumer may have grounds for disputing this information with XXXX and seeking its removal from their credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

text: I wrote in to CFPB on XX/XX/2020 about a issue on my Equifax credit report. I told this company that I had a debt that was reinserted or never removed even though the updated report stated that it was removed. Equifax wrote back to CFPB on XXXX XXXX saying that they mailed me a update but nothing was updated. As of today this debt is still appearing on my report and if an item as erased and is reinserted afterwards, the FCRA requires that the CRA send you written notice of the reinsertion within 5 days. When you receive the notice, you will have to go through the same process to contest the mark as you did the first time. When you contest the reinsertion, you may want to include paperwork showing that the mark was previously contested, and removed. I did not receive any kind of notice from Equifax about this reinsertion. Negative mark is confirmed, I did not get no response, They have violated the FCRA. Neither the creditor nor the CRA can argue that they incorrectly deleted the item the first time, or that the mark was removed in error ; if it was removed pursuant to your prior letter informing the CRA that the mark is inaccurate, it can not be reinserted for any reason.

text: I have been corresponding back and forth with XXXX and now XXXX for the past year regarding the late payments they are reporting on my account with the credit reporting agencies ( Equifax, XXXX and XXXX XXXX ). My argument is that the accounts have been in forbearance for pretty much the life of the loans, so any payments that I have made has been only when interest payments are arranged, which I get emails when payments are due and I pay them, as you will also see on the statements. text: Since last year of 2022 I have been going back and forth with the data/credit reporting agency LCI about their CONSTANT violations of my rights by reporting inaccurate information concerning a bankruptcy to the XXXX credit bureau . So if thats the case, how did LCI verify my bankruptcy as 100 % Accurate? ... They never did a fair investigation according to the 15 USC 1681. 15 USC 1681 section 603 ( 3 ) ( E ) States ; The term investigative consumer report means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is obtained through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. However, such information shall not include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer. text: My name is XXXX XXXX and in XXXX I had to file Chapter XXXX. It was the only way to save my home, I am the only person working in my house. I have children and my wife to provide for. I opened new credit cards, my mortgage payments were on time, I had a stable job, etc. I noticed that my car and house policies increased in price. Then, at the end of my policy renovation, I saw an explanation from my insurance company with the reason why my policy was going up in the first place ( due to the report from LexisNexis ). My agent told me to contact them and see if they can fix the problem. I contacted them and they sent me a huge report with my credit history, saying that there is nothing they can do because my record was updated at that time. I was saddened and upset by the situation. All I thought about was if it even was possible to fix this situation, eventually, I let it pass.   Today, I rechecked my policy renovation and again I noticed the same negative report of my credit history. It demonstrated the same misleading information that was supposed to be fixed. I say that because I have an account with XX/XX/XXXX the credit bureau, which monitors my credit. I also protect my social security and as well as my family 's. My credit now is very different from what it was in XXXX and even in XXXX. I realized that I had to converse with the customer representative from my insurance company. I spoke to the underwriter and she told me that the employees from Lexis Nexis never updated my reports, even when I asked them in XXXX to do so. When I explained my situation to her, she decided to remove LexisNexis from my insurance policies, and right away my premium went down almost {$1600.00} per year. The damage done to my familial economy by this situation is inexcusable, simply because of the incompetence of this company. text: I wrote to your company indicating my dispute of information in my credit report. Equifax has not responded to my dispute and therefore must update my credit file. The late date which is actually submitted on my credit report sounds very inaccurate or deceptive. Under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Disclosures to consumers [ 15 U.S.C. 1681g ] ( ( a ) Information on file ; sources ; report recipients. Equifax shall, upon request, and subject to 610 ( a ) ( 1 ) [ 1681h ], clearly and accurately disclose to the consumer. If the consumer to whom the file relates requests that the first 5 digits of the social security number ( or similar identification number ) of the consumer not be included in the disclosure and the consumer reporting agency has received appropriate proof of the identity of the requester, the consumer reporting agency shall so truncate such number in such disclosure. & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] ( a ) Reinvestigations of Disputed Information. If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in my file at Equifax is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a creditor, the Bureaus shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the items from my file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or creditor. text: I am writing to inform you that you are in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) for reporting information about my account without my consent. The specific laws that you are violating are listed below in this notarized letter, according to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) laws, rules, and regulations.  No one has received my written or oral consent to publish any transactions to my consumer credit report, which is a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ), which states that any person who knowingly and willfully obtains information on a consumer from a consumer reporting agency under false pretenses shall be fined under title 18, United States Code, imprisoned for not more than 2 years, or both.  In accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( d ), the term " consumer '' means an individual and the term " consumer report '' means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumer 's creditworthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumer 's eligibility for credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes, or for other purposes authorized under section 1681b of this title.  I demand that you email me a copy of my consumer report you have in file immediately since this will be the second time I ask for this and have yet to receive it.   I have provided my license and paystub for immediate response.

text: This has been going on for 2 years now. In 2019 I reported 2 frauds on 2 different credit cards I had with Bank Of America. One of the claims was approved and the second was not approved, when I asked why one of the claims was not approved when they were filed the same day and for the same reason, no one could give me an answer. I was told I would need to pay over 10k dollars. I reopened the claim and filed a police report and collected information from my employer, including XXXX, the company through which my company used the email client where it showed that the person 's XXXX address that hacked our company was in XXXX XXXX. During the investigation, the money wasn't paid because the claim was still open, but at the end, after sending them about 20 pages of proof, police reports, etc, Bank of America said I was still liable and had to pay the amount. My employer was nice enough to reimburse me because we were hacked and that's how my personal card was compromised. The issue was that BoA counted the time of the open investigation as late payments when the person at their local branch AND ON THE PHONE said, that wouldn't count against my credit score. They refused to remove the late payments that show on my credit score because I the fee was not waived and if the fee is not waived, the late payment counts against me, which is something they never displayed to me and as a matter of fact they told me the opposite. I have been fighting to remove this for two years and it's affecting my ability to buy a home. I owe BoA nothing, I paid the 10k for which I was scammed and they still refuse to remove the late payments from my credit score. Please help me. If this does not work I have to file a report with the FBI for the online fraud and see if this will escalate things with BoA.

text: The credit bureaus keep disrespecting the laws. I showed them multiple times of how they are violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act.   According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) is codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.  Section 1681e of the FCRA sets forth the requirements for accuracy in credit reporting and includes provisions related to the reporting of bankruptcies. Specifically, subsection ( b ) of Section 1681e states that a credit reporting agency may not furnish a consumer report containing information on a bankruptcy case that is more than 10 years old.  Additionally, Section 1681i of the FCRA provides consumers with the right to dispute inaccurate information in their credit reports, including information related to bankruptcies. The credit reporting agency is required to investigate and correct any inaccuracies found during the dispute process.  According to 15 USC 1681i ( 5 ) the credit bureaus have to modify or delete accounts that are not reporting accurately According to 15 USC 1681b ( 1 ) the credit bureaus dont have no written premission According to 15 USC 1681 I have the right to privacy According to 15 USC 1681s-2 A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.  ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.

text: I received my credit report and noticed violations under the 15 us code 1681 and 15 us code 1681b ( FCRA ). The law clearly states the following15 us code 1681b ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. Meaning that if you do not have or havent gotten any written instructions from me ( the consumer ) to furnish an account on my report. It should not be there. That is a violation. I never gave written instruction to furnish any of the following accounts. Secondly according to the 15 us code 1681.The law clearly states 1. Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting. The Congress makes the following findings : 2. The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system ( 4 ) There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. ( b ) Reasonable procedures It is the purpose of this subchapter to require that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures for meeting the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information in a manner which is fair and equitable to the consumer, with regard to the confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and proper utilization of such information in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter. I sent out a letter To Verify The Accuracy On Credit Report and I did not get a response. So I send out another letter just in case they didn't receive it still no respond. Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified accounts MUST be promptly deleted. I have the list of accounts that are inaccurate and its in clear violation of my privacy. Which is a violation of the law. This is embarrassing and damaging to my reputation as a consumer. text: Per previous submitted response from complaint XXXX Equifax has completed its investigation, including contacting the furnisher of the information, where applicable.However according to Investigative Consumer Reports . Section 606 contains specific requirements for use of an investigative consumer report. This type of consumer report contains information about a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living obtained in whole or in part through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer. If a user, such as a financial institution, procures an investigative consumer report, or causes the preparation of one, the user institution must meet the following requirements : 4. The user clearly and accurately discloses to the consumer that it may obtain an investigative consumer report.  5. The disclosure contains a statement of the consumers right to request other information about the report and a summary of the consumers rights under the FCRA.  6. The disclosure is in writing and is mailed or otherwise delivered to the consumer not later than three business days after the date on which the report was first requested.  7. The user procuring the report certifies to the consumer reporting agency that it has complied with the disclosure requirements and will comply in the event that the consumer requests additional disclosures about the report. Equifax has neglected to perform any of the required investigating Requirements to properly perform a CONSUMER INVESTIGATION. As previoulsy stated in last complaint, accounts listed are innaccurate and have been reported on my credit report without my consent. COMPLETELY violating my privacy rights 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 section 1 states that have a right to privacy and 5 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 section 2 states written consent must be provided to do so.account number XXXX Date : XXXX, XXXX Amount : {$22000.00}, Account number XXXX Date : XXXX XXXX Amount : {$3000.00}, Account number XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Amount : {$2400.00}, Account number : XXXX Date : XXXX Amount {$2100.00}. The listed accounts are affecting my character and illegally reporting derogatory inaccurate information. Per the FCA entities are subject to {$1000.00} per violation in fines for knowingly and recklessly reporting information. In addition to neglecting to perform an accurate FULL INVESTIGATION CONSUMER REPORT. I demand that these accounts be deleted immediately.

Section 7 ( 1-C ) of the Freedom of Information Act ( 5 ILCS 140/7 ) from Ch 116, par.207 ), notes as, " Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy. '' This is defined as " the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject 's right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information.  Also according to the law 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy. If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such disputes, the agency shall, free charge, conduct a reinvestigation of determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller. text: The account in question has been disputed several times and XXXX XXXX XXXX has verified to Equifax that the account is accurate, XXXX XXXX XXXX  has failed to provide me with documents that I requested several months ago. This issue has been very inconvenient to deal with as no documentation has been provided to me. To this day the account continues to be reporting to my credit report. I would like Equifax to provide me all documents showing my signature on them showing me that I indeed have a debt with the collection agency claiming that I owe. If Equifax can not provide me with a signature documents, I request that the account be permanently deleted from my credit report. Please also attach copies of any agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he or she agreed to pay the creditor and as this is a medical account, a copy of any HIPAA authorization.  To refresh your memory on what constitutes legal debt validation, I am providing you a list of the required documentation : Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established via Spears v Brennan 745 N.E.2d 862 ; 2001 Ind. App XXXX  509.  Agreement that bears the signature of the alleged debtor wherein he/she agreed to pay the original creditor. Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company. ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect this alleged debt. Coppola v. Arrow Financial Services, 302CV577, XXXX WL 32173704 ( D. Conn., XXXX XXXX  - Information relating to the purchase of a bad debt is not proprietary or burdensome. Debtor must phrase their request clearly to obtain : The source of a debt and the amount a bad debt buyer paid for plaintiffs debt, how amount sought was calculated, where in issue a list of reports to credit bureaus, and documents conferring authority on defendant to collect debt.   Intimate knowledge of the creation of the debt by you, the collection agency.  As Im sure you are aware, under FDCPA Section 809 ( b ), you are not allowed to pursue collection activity until the debt is validated. You should be aware that in TWYLA BOATLEY, Plaintiff, vs DIEM CORPORTATION, No. CIV 030762 UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ARIZONAXXXX XXXX the courts ruled that reporting a collection account indeed is considered collection activity.   While I prefer not to litigate, I will use the courts as needed to enforce my rights under the FDCPA

text: In 32 YEARS my credit history every single account, including credit cards for large and small purchases, a mortgage obligation, equity line of credit, all of these were paid on time NEVER a missed or late payment.   For 2 months, I was not able to receive or reply to mail and not able to access communication online, as I was camping and consumed with searching for a home to buy. It was only after I purchased and moved in to my new home that I became aware of the overdue account. I immediately called the credit department at XXXX XXXX, requested and was granted the elimination of late fees, paid the {$17.00} for the flashlight and closed the account.   With that history of ALWAYS paying credit obligations ON TIME, why would I jeopardize my excellent credit history and PURPOSELY be late on a purchase of a {$17.00} flashlight?   XXXX XXXX and their bank, Citibank, are making a mountain out of a molehill. Based on my circumstances, it is extremely unfair and a miscarriage of justice to flag my credit history with a late charge and drop my credit score by 100 points for an overlooked {$17.00} charge. Im asking for some COMMON SENSE to be applied in my individual case and for Citibank to remove the negative 30 day late notification and inform the credit agencies that my record is spotless.   Fairness = equitable = morally right.  Legal : Relating to the general principles of justice that correct or supplement the provisions of the law.   THE FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( FCRA ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681 ] 602. Congressional findings and statement of purpose [ 15 U.S.C. 1681 ] ( a ) Accuracy and fairness of credit reporting. The Congress makes the following findings : ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting.  Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

text: Dear Equifax, I am writing to dispute the inaccurate and damaging information being reported on my credit report regarding my bankruptcy. I believe that your company is in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) by selling, transferring, and reporting inaccurate information to potential creditors.   As per the FCRA 15 USC 1681, a credit reporting agency can be sued for negligent or willful compliance with the law within two years after discovering harmful behavior, or within five years if the harmful behavior occurred. Furthermore, the FDCPA prohibits debt collectors from using false, misleading, or deceptive practices when collecting a debt.   I am requesting that Equifax contact the United States bankruptcy court to verify the accuracy of the information being reported. I also request the following information to support your Metro 2 compliance for consumer and commercial credit reporting : -A copy of your written policies and procedures for Metro 2 compliance in consumer and commercial credit reporting.  -Information on how your company obtains and verifies the accuracy of consumer and commercial credit information, and how it ensures that information is reported in accordance with Metro 2 guidelines.  -Details on any training or education provided to your employees regarding Metro 2 compliance in consumer and commercial credit reporting.  -Information on the systems and technology used by your company to report consumer and commercial credit information in Metro 2 format.  -Details on whether your company has undergone any audits or assessments of its Metro 2 compliance practices, and if so, request copies of the reports or findings.  I would also like to remind Equifax of their duty to report accurate information and not engage in any practices that may be considered defamation of character or misrepresentation of creditworthiness. Any such actions may result in potential legal action.  Finally, I would like to request information on the United States Bankruptcy Court 's role as a credit reporting agency and how they obtained and transferred the information being reported. I also request information on the statues and laws related to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and how they apply to this situation.   Thank you for your attention to this matter.   Sincerely, Attached information : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/1978.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: I shared a lease for my wife at the times XXXX XXXX. In XXXX of 2020, during the COVID lockdown, we had both been furloughed from our jobs and were unable to make payments on the car during that time. Before we were late with a payment, she called Nissan to ask if they would be willing to pause our payments until we were able to pay again. They agreed and had done it with many customers already. We were grateful. In XXXX of 2020 ( do not remember the exact day ), I had just been able to get back to doing some work and received multiple calls from Nissan that informed me that we were late on our payments. I asked my wife to call them and ask if there was a problem. She called and the Nissan representative told her they were automated calls about being late and to ignore them as we had paused our payments only about a month earlier. I continued to receive these automated calls over the following weeks so I called Nissan personally to ask them to stop calling. At this point the representative informed me that the payment pause was only for one month and if we wanted to extend it we would have needed to call in again. This was absolutely not made clear at the time of the pause. and then on top of that, we were told to ignore the late payment calls. How are we supposed to know if a Nissan representative is telling us accurate information or not? We made the mistake of assuming they were giving us credible information and we ended up being hit with a 30 day late note on our reports. I had never over many years with NMAC been late with a payment. And as soon as I called and spoke with the representative, I paid the entire back balance ( two months ) along with the remainder of the lease ( ended up totaling about 4 months of payments ) immediately on the phone with him. I then wrote Nissan explaining this situation and they told me they would not correct it. This is deceptive and during a time like COVID lockdown where people needed help, Nissan offered help and then punished us for accepting it. It was the wrong way to handle the situation.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: On or about XX/XX/XXXX I purchased a vehicle from XXXX XXXX XXXX for {$17000.00}, financed through XXXX XXXX. The car was repossessed on or about XX/XX/XXXX.   I mailed a letter to XXXX and XXXX XXXX disputing the full amount of the vehicle XXXX is requesting me to pay, since the vehicle has been sold, I should not owe the full amount. After the vehicle was repossessed, I did not receive any notices.   1 ) Notices should have states that they have the car in their possession and that the car will be sold to recover the amount owed ( this is called the Notice of Sale, which I did not receive. ) This notice should have been sent to me within ten days of their possession of the vehicle. Since they did not provide me with this information they can be barred from collecting on a deficiency judgment.  2 ) After the vehicle was sold the lender then is required to send me a second notice, stating the amount that they credited me from the resale, as well as a cancellation notice of the original sales contract.   Additionally, there were GAP Insurance and service contract on the vehicle into the original purchase, these amounts should have been deducted from the amount that the XXXX states I own.

text: I filed a dispute with XXXX  XXXX Bank ( USA XXXX Na over 30 days ago and they have yet to respond to my Affidavit Of Truth, which was sent to them via certified mail. Which they received on XX/XX/21 and they have failed to answer. I informed XXXX XXXX Bank ( USA ) Na that I am disputing their claim. Moreover I requested that XXXX XXXX XXXX ( USA ) Na supply me with copy of the contract with my authentic signature and their authentic signature which makes the contract legal. XXXX XXXXXXXX Bank ( USA XXXX Na never provided a copy of contract with my authentic signature or their authentic signature and continue to report this account to the credit reporting agency. This account should have been deleted off the CRA files. Further more the fair credit reporting act regulates how creditors handle consumers dispute. The statue states that when a consumer disputes any item the creditor should conduct a reasonable investigation within 30 days to determine if the challenge item is correct. After 30 days have expired if creditor have not completed the investigation the disputed item must be deleted. Finally XXXX  XXXX Bank ( USA ) Na failed to report the dispute to the CRA which is a violation of the FCRA section 623 and carries a fine. XXXX XXXX Bank ( USA ) NA has failed to show burden of proof 15 U.S. Code 1643 ( b ) Burden of proof In any action by a card issuer to enforce liability for the use of a credit card, the burden of proof is upon the card issuer to show that the use was authorized or, if the use was unauthorized, then the burden of proof is upon the card issuer to show that the conditions of liability for the unauthorized use of a credit card, as set forth in subsection ( a ), have been met. XXXX  XXXX Bank ( USA ) NA has failed to reply to the affidavit, its has been well over 30 days. I am asking that all negative remarks be removed from my credit file which XXXX XXXX Bank ( USA ) NA falsely created.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: These companies are furnishing information that they should not and they do not have consent to do for these alleged debts. I've asked them to validate date the debt and they have failed to. Their violation of my rights as a consumer fall under 18 USC 1028A-Aggravated Identity Theft. It states the following : ( a ) Offenses.  ( 1 ) In general.  Whoever, during and in relation to any felony violation enumerated in subsection ( c ), knowingly transfers, possesses, or uses, without lawful authority, a means of identification of another person shall, in addition to the punishment provided for such felony, be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of 2 years.  To add insult to injury, they have no permissible purpose pursuant to 15 USC 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports- ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.  Did I give written instructions? I did not.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: On XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed by a lender with whom I was attempting to refinance my mortgage that there was a negative mark on my credit report. Specifically, and entry was made on my credit report that a collection was reported for {$730.00} by XXXX , XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. This came as a surprise as in XX/XX/XXXX I had received a credit score in excess of 800 with no negative marks.  I called XXXX who informed me that the debt was in relation to a visit to XXXX XXXX XXXX Hospital in XXXX or XXXX of XXXX. I did not recall ever receiving any such bill for the visit in XXXX, and so I asked XXXX what address the bill was sent to. I was told that it was sent to an address that I last lived in XXXX of XXXX. A simple XXXX search will show my current address and so it is clear that no attempt was made to confirm the address or else I would have received notice of the collection activity. I received none. In fact, I to date still have not seen a bill for the service. This seems to be a clear example of debt " parking '' on behalf of XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX Hospital. XXXX said if I would pay the bill over the phone and then dispute the issue with the credit reporting agency that they would confirm that they had sent the bill to the incorrect address.  I paid the amount owed over the phone ( despite still not having received a bill ), and filed disputes with all three major reporting agencies. I have since received results that they have simply updated my report to show that the amount was paid in full, but the collection activity remains. I've been able to make contact on the phone with at least one agency ( XXXX ) who confirmed that they did not actually investigate my claim that I never received a bill, but instead brought the dispute to conclusion when they saw the amount was paid in full. It is clear that this must be the case with the other two as well.  For the record, I do not believe that I had ever been to XXXX XXXX XXXX Hospital ever before the visit at the end of XXXX. I recall filling out several forms that included my current address. I had been a patient at XXXX XXXX Hospital XXXX in the XXXX time frame, and assume that the billing department at XXXX simply used the old address that was in the system for my years earlier visit to XXXX Hospital XXXX rather than the updated address information that I provided to the receptionist in XXXX on my visit to XXXX XXXX   Hospital.  I am now having difficulty in receiving credit from mortgage providers as I attempt to refinance.

text: To whom it my concern, Several months ago I pulled my credit report from all three major bureaus. There were several items being reported that I did not recognize. I disputed these items with the 3 bureaus and several of them were deleted. 2 accounts were not deleted, however. Portfolio Recovery Associates, LLC ( PRA ) Is reporting 2 accounts that I don't recognize. I disputed the accounts with the 3 bureaus and directly with PRA. I had never received ANY communication with PRA concerning these 2 accounts until AFTER I initiated the dispute process. Once I began the dispute process PRA sent a printout of an old statement from both accounts. The copies of the original statements showed that they were originally addressed to 2 different addresses, both of which belonged to my father. My father and I share the same name with no differentiating title, i.e. junior, senior, etc. I sent a letter to the 3 bureaus and PRA requesting more information/proof that the accounts were mine. I have received no such proof from either PRA or the 3 credit bureaus. I keep receiving the same form letter from PRA that lists name, account number, date account was opened, balance, etc. The ONLY original information I have ever received is one copy of a credit card statement from both accounts which both list addresses that belonged to my father. I believe that PRA and the three credit reporting bureaus have NOT performed a proper investigation, even after being requested to do so, and continue to use the XXXX system in order to " validate '' the accounts. I simply want proof that these 2 accounts are mine and not my fathers and to have these 2 accounts DELETED from my credit profile if proof can not be produced.  Thank You

text: On XX/XX/2018 I mailed the credit bureau a letter requesting them to remove dismissed & unconfirmed bankruptcies from my credit report. I stated that I was outraged that their company continues to maintain multiple dismissed ( filed ) bankruptcies as confirmed on my credit report. These unconfirmed, unverified, and dismissed ( filed ) bankruptcies have stopped me from obtaining credit. I know for a fact these companies receive information on bankruptcy from a third party system known as a Pacer System. The Pacer System is inaccurate and incomplete since the Pacer System does not provide complete social security numbers as that would be against the Fair Credit Reporting Act and Privacy Laws. Furthermore, I have been in contact with the county courthouse and they also assured me they do not report full social security numbers to thirty parties or make social security numbers public record. Even though it the credit bureaus policy to keep reporting a bankruptcy that is filed, dismissed, or adjudicated for 10 years, the Fair Credit Reporting Act mentions nothing in Section 1681 ( c ) relating to bankruptcy about dismissals or filings. The law is very clear and states from date of adjudication or date of order of relief.  Any case, whether it be civil or otherwise, once dismissed it no longer exists in the eyes of the law. This case filed may never have actually been adjudicated. They have no right to maintain information which the government has deemed non-existent. It is only fair that in accordance with section 1618 ( a ) ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act they delete this from my credit report and send me an updated copy.  Considering this does not require an investigation, I would appreciated an updated copy of my credit report showing no bankruptcy within two weeks from the date you receive this.
