text: In the summer of XXXX, hackers accessed Equifax 's system and compromised the personal credit information of over 100 million users. Equifax, failed to provide adequate cyber security throughout their computer system despite knowing the inherent value of the consumer information they possess. As demonstrated by the severity of this security breach, Equifax was absurdly negligent in properly securing the personal information of millions of consumers, and can no longer be trusted to act in the best interest of the American public.   I am one of the victims of this breach. Equifax 's offer of one year of credit monitoring is a mere token of whats necessary to protect myslef. Equifaxs data breach is not something I can fix with a new password. For the rest of my life, I will need to watch my credit activity closely. I am XXXX, and I have family members currently in their XXXX. That means I will need to monitor my credit activity for the next 40 to 50 YEARS!   Ironically, Equifax is happy to charge me for additional protective services, something I would not require if they had done their job adequately in the beginning.   I demand that Equifax is stripped of their ability to provide credit reports in the future. Their negligence in this matter proves that they are simply unable to protect consumer data. Based on this breach, I do not believe any bank, other financial institution or business can safely rely on the reports that Equifax might produce in the future. Simply, Equifax can no longer be trusted.   I further demand that Equifax provide a lifetime of credit monitoring for me and any other consumer who is likewise affected by the negligence of Equifax. Life-long credit monitoring - in reality - is the LEAST that Equifax should offer affected consumers. They were negligent, and they do n't appear to care the slightest about the people whose lives ' they have disrupted. They simply care about their financial stability, and how they can minimize the effect this breach will have on their profits.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: On or about the XX/XX/2022 ; I contacted XXXX and advised them that I was going to pay off the security system which I had purchased from XXXX. XXXX 's method of my paying in order to install the system directly was through using retain credit from XXXX. I applied while the XXXX sales person was at my house per his instruction. The {$4000.00} sale of the system was approved by XXXX. They subsequently sent me a card with the name XXXX retail credit on it and a number. There is no credit card information on the card. That is, with the exception that the funding is secured by the XXXX XXXX XXXX. It goes on to say " for participating locations only. '' There is no expiration date or security code on the card.   I contacted the vendor XX/XX/2022 and advised them that, I had sent them a check for {$4000.00} via priority mail. I also told XXXX that I'd checked my Equifax credit report and that they miscategorized my credit to the credit bureaus, wherein, they listed they had provided me with a {$4000.00} credit card limit and I had used all of that limit to make a purchase. This dropped my credit score XXXX points, because XXXX told the credit bureau ( Equifax ), that I had a credit card with revolving credit. That statement was and is a lie, because that account was only opened for the purchase and installation of a new home security system.   When in fact, the installment agreement has me paying {$66.00} approximately per month with no interest every month until the account was paid off.   XXXX has no intention of following the law. They said as much by saying that no matter what I said, they were going to take 60 to 90 days to complete an investigation. Further, that they view my account as a revolving credit card account no matter what the card says or does not say. Most likely my credit report will not be corrected to show the account is an installment account. It will continue to show as though it is a credit card.   This is wrong and I totally disagree. I say they are breaking the law and trampling my rights as this is what big business does on a regular basis, because they keep getting away with it breaking the laws in the US.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: I, hereby declare under penalty of perjury that I am the victim of identity theft. In XXXX, 2023, I discovered that someone had obtained my personal information without my authorization and used it to apply for credit, resulting in the following inquiries on my credit report : I did not initiate or authorize these credit inquiries, and I believe they are the result of fraudulent activity committed by the identity thief. I am submitting this identity theft affidavit to request that the credit reporting agencies remove these inquiries from my credit report, as they are not a true reflection of my credit history.   Additionally, I am disputing negative marks regarding open credit accounts that were reported on my credit report by XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax. I believe that this information should not have been included on my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ).   As you are aware, this provision excludes from the definition of a consumer report any report that contains information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report. In my case, the negative mark that was reported relates solely to a transaction or experience between me and the creditor, and therefore should not have been included on my credit report.   With the exception of XXXX XXXX XXXX, which should be deleted in its entirety due to identity theft, I also want to bring to your attention that the balances being reported on the other open credit card accounts are in fact, XXXX ( {$0.00} ) and should be marked Paid As Agreed, and are under dispute under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), specifically under 15 U.S. Code 1640 ( a ) ( 1 ) and 12 C.F.R. 1026.38.   Under these provisions, I have the right to dispute any billing errors or unauthorized charges that XXXX have been applied to my account and those accounts should accurately reflect my true account status until the disputes are settled, to the satisfaction of the consumer. I have already initiated the dispute process with the creditor, and have provided all relevant documentation to support my claim.   Given the facts presented above, I am requesting that you remove the negative mark from my credit report as soon as possible. text: Hello, I am writing to dispute the inaccurate information on my credit report that has been reported by XXXX. According to all three credit bureaus, I was reported as 30 days late on XX/XX/XXXX, even though I did not miss any payment on this account. Furthermore, XXXX and Equifax reported a High Credit of {$1200.00}, while XXXX reported {$1200.00}. Additionally, XXXX and Equifax reported the Last Reported Date as XX/XX/2022, while XXXX reported XX/XX/2022. Lastly, XXXX and Equifax reported the Date Last Active as XX/XX/2022, while XXXX reported XX/XX/2022. These inaccuracies have significantly impacted my life and financial well-being.   I am requesting that you enforce the legal requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) to ensure that the information reported by XXXX is accurate and complete. Specifically, I believe that XXXX has violated the following provisions of the FCRA and FACTA : Section 607 ( b ) of the FCRA, which requires data furnishers to provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies, and to correct any errors upon notice from a credit reporting agency or a consumer.  Section 611 ( a ) of the FCRA, which requires credit reporting agencies to investigate and correct any inaccurate information in a consumer 's credit report, and to notify the consumer of the results of the investigation within a reasonable time period.  Section 312 of the FACTA, which amends the FCRA to require data furnishers to establish and maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information they provide to credit reporting agencies, and to correct any inaccuracies upon notice from a credit reporting agency or a consumer.  Section 312 ( c ) of the FACTA, which provides immunity from liability for data furnishers that comply with reasonable procedures for accuracy and completeness of information.  Section 312 ( d ) of the FACTA, which authorizes the FTC to promulgate guidelines and regulations regarding the accuracy and completeness of credit information.   I want to emphasize how these inaccuracies have affected my life. As a single mother, I am constantly struggling to make ends meet and provide for my family. Having inaccurate information on my credit report has made it extremely difficult for me to obtain loans and credit when I need it most. I have been denied credit and loans due to these inaccuracies, which has caused me to miss out on opportunities and financial stability.   In light of the violations of the FCRA and XXXX by XXXX, I respectfully request that the unverified account information be removed from my credit report immediately. I also request that XXXX takes corrective action to ensure that my credit report accurately reflects my payment history.   Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.   Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: I was a victim of a XXXX XXXX  XXXX data breach. My information was compromised and sold through the dark web. The use of a unique PIN is in place for XXXX and XXXX, however the bad actor is easily able to access an account through a line of questions ( no different than accessing normally ) to obtain the PIN and remove the freeze and fraud alert. text: Montgomery Wards is reporting derogatory information onto my consumer report that needs to be removed. text: REQUEST FOR XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX!!!  I believe that each consumer reporting agency has invalidated the true spirit of the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act. The Act first established XX/XX/2003 was intended to establish a plan whereas common American citizens could obtain a copy of their credit reports at least once a year free of charge. Since each credit reporting agency now has marketing divisions such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX  XXXX, the automation system to obtain the free annual reports is looped into an information request to steer citizens into additional product offers that are excessive and unnecessary. Even though I may have received an approval of an updated credit report from either XXXX, XXXX XXXX or Equifax respectively, it is unfair that I need to do a mail request since I can submit my personal information through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. I believe that since the CFPB is the sole responsible oversight party of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, its imperative that any additional solicitation of information from the credit bureaus should be blocked permanently. I along with any other citizen should receive a free credit report upon request. The credit reporting agencies are an important aspect of the national banking system to properly function, but the current aggressive marketing campaign soliciting citizens for an arbitrary FICO score has gone too far, including but not limited to XXXX  XXXX. We must return to a common ground that is fair for all consumers in the United States, and we must be able to request additional marketing on our own terms. Accordingly, I am making a request for a free credit report with confirmation number to my attached email address. Thank you.  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, PA XXXX SS # ENDING IN XXXX

text: Dear Legal Department, This credit dispute is being submitted as a new evidence dispute. The accounts that are being disputed, does not belong to me. Further, I certify that I am qualified and authorized to file this dispute. Additionally, these misstatements are punishable l1S perjury under 18U.S.C. 1621. It is my official statement that someone and/or several people have opened these accounts and made transactions on these accounts without my knowledge or authorization, my personal information has been used to obtain goods, services, or money : and the person ( s ) responsible for creating these accounts.   I have filed a report with the Federal Trade Commission, which I have enclosed within this dispute package. I have reached out to all of these creditors and have made them aware that these accounts were fraudulently opened, and they have known this for several months, but have yet to remove these accounts from my credit reports. Some of the creditors have been cooperative and have removed the accounts, but others have refused to remove the fraudulent accounts. Therefore, I have come to you, the credit reporting agencies to resolve these issues. The law says that you must block these accounts while being investigated, and I expect that you will do so. text: I made my XX/XX/XXXX payment on the last day of the month ( XX/XX/XXXX ) through the servicer 's website, which routes you to XXXX to process the transaction. The payment date that prefilled in that payment information screen was XX/XX/XXXX and the confirmation page again confirmed a " payment date '' of XX/XX/XXXX. However, the servicer credited the payment effective XX/XX/XXXX despite the confirmation provided through their vendor 's website and they are unwilling to honor it or correct it. They stated that regardless of the payment date confirmed through the speedpay transaction, there's a box that you click on which has a list if disclaimers about the cut off time to process your payments same day. No one is going to look through all these hidden disclaimers to find that information. Consumers are going to go off of the payment date that you are allowed to enter when processing the payment. All other creditors pre-fill that date to the following business day if the transaction is after the cutoff but not Carrington. This is a disconnect between the servicer and their vendor ( which they're still on the hook for ) and rather than fixing the issue and correcting it going forward, its easier for them to reject any liability for the error. Bottom line is that if the payment is being made after their cut off, the payment date made available to the customer should not reflect an incorrect date, it should automatically flip to the next business date so there's absolutely no confusion. This is unfair and deceptive business practices which is confusing to their customers, yet they fail to acknowledge that.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: In XXXX I realized I was beyond 30 days behind on my personal loan payment with XXXX. In the past through 2020 I have had income issues related to lost business  from COVID. I had to contacted them to let them know my payment may be past 30 days late. As soon as I could, I payed both the past due and soon after the current month was caught up. After having never reported a payment late before as long as I had spoken with them and arranged repayment, they reported this payment late. Inconsistent reporting, leaves you very confused about the relationship with a lender. Needless to say, this resulted in an 80+ point drop in my credit score, destroying it. The account has been brought current, but is currently just a few days behind and will be caught up in a matter of days. If they are going to enforce their rules, they should do it in all cases. In my case I have had always kept it paid, and when I got behind it was brought up quickly. Please have the late payment for this account removed. Fair is fair, especially as we are trying to recover from an economic situation we did not cause, want or ask for.

text: Comfirmation Number # XXXX I will like for your company to send me documentary evidence on the people your company did interviews on send to the above address.   Pursuant to the FCRA Fair Credit Reporting Act 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( e ) The term investigative consumer report means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is obtained through personal interviews with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. However, such information shall not include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer.

text: My problem is with Toyota Financial Services : 1. Toyota Financial Services- In XXXX I lost my job due to covid-19. text: Using the information on 'best practices ' that these credit bureaus provide, I have reduced my usage to below 1 %, paid off all outstanding debt, made all payments on time, etc.   Today, XX/XX/2020, Overnight my credit score plummeted by 64 points ( Equifax ) and by 20 points ( XXXX ) because my credit card numbers were changed. According to the information that XXXX XXXX provided, those were the only change on my account. Even though, the explanation I received stated that the changed CC numbers should have no impact.   Additionally, the length of the oldest credit is stated as just over 2 years because I paid off student loans a few months ago - which also has an impact on my score. So, because I paid off the loan, it no longer qualifies as 'oldest credit. ' It appears that the more I follow the stated 'guidelines ' that the credit bureaus provide, the lower my credit score. The rating system seems at odds with the advice that the bureaus provide and this is reflected in my credit.   Perhaps the algorithm that calculates such things should reflect what the consumer is being advised or vice versa.

text: 3rd REQUEST FOR ACTION!   I recently submitted several complaints to XXXX  & LexisNexis regarding a Chapter XXXX  bankruptcy reporting on my credit report. After careful investigation and wording of the law, it states the following : According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) a Chapter XXXX  bankruptcy CAN remain on your credit history for UP TO 10-years from the filing date. For a Chapter XXXX  bankruptcy, the maximum is seven years, like most other negative items. There are some key phrases in that statement that need to be clarified : 1. " CAN '' - The FCRA does not require that a bankruptcy remains on your credit report a full decade.   2. " UP TO '' - Again, 10 years is not a legal minimum, it is the maximum. So, legally, bankruptcy CAN BE REMOVED from a credit report before that limit is reached. My bankruptcy is scheduled to be deleted in XX/XX/2020.   I am applying for a mortgage and this is severely impacting my ability to obtain reasonable financing. I am asking LexisNexis & XXXX  to read the above law by the FCRA and delete this item.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: We are asking you to investigate the impact that that our Bank of America Home Equity line of credit has had on our credit.   We were struggling with payments beginning in XXXX on our HELOC, and in early XXXX learned we may be eligible for a modification. We wanted to ensure we were taking care of the situation so we began to seek out resolution.   Timeline Mid XXXX -- reached out to begin finding out if we could get a trial modification. Took quite a while to finally get to a point where they would talk to us about a trial modification.  XX/XX/XXXX approved to start trial modification XXXX completed the three trial modification payments ( proof in bank statements provided ) XX/XX/XXXX finally get a letter after persistent questions of status and decision that our modification is approved. We returned the final modification paperwork, never got anything back.  XX/XX/XXXX get a letter saying our modification was denied.  XX/XX/XXXX get a letter saying its now approved, see no evidence of this in our monthly payment ; still shows massive snowball amount.  XX/XX/XXXX get a new letter saying we successfully completed trial modification and to sign and return the modification agreement, which we did.  XXXX still seeing no evidence they had modified the loan, unsuccessful in getting answers. Finally hear from someone that they had sent more paperwork, and they had sent it to the wrong address. We were temporarily living in XXXX for 8 months. We had updated our mailing address to our temporary address in XXXX, and we were receiving billing from them at that address but they mailed new loan modification paperwork ( 3rd time around I think? ) to our home property address, which we did not receive as it was not forwarded by our renters.   XXXXwe send a fax to BOA appeals intake, requesting them to send the paperwork yet again, they never did.   XXXXthey transfer the loan to XXXX XXXX and we have such a horrendous impact on our credit its almost worse than bankruptcy.   This account should have been modified and would not have been needed to be transferred off to XXXX XXXX.    It was like getting stuck in a loop. We would provide and sign whatever next paperwork or evidence they requested, and then we would get something else that they said they needed. It took so much energy, they seemed determined to bury us in paperwork and confusion rather than give us the modification. I gave up.   Included for consideration is the various documents from Bank of America indicating we had successfully completed modification, as well as correspondence that demonstrates the diligence with which we tried to resolve the matter.  Included : All the documentation that our loan was modified from Bank of America.  Copies of correspondence showing the diligence in which we attempted to resolve this account.  Proof of the payments to fulfill the trial modification period through our bank statements.

text: I have an ID Notify credit monitoring account with Equifax due to the XXXX hack of a few years past. My Social Security Number was among those hacked. I keep a folder of just that correspondence.   After being responsible for such a hack, Equifax should work to protect me, not allow a scam using my good name and credit. This is not the case.  In XXXX I found a negative and damaging report on my ID Notify site.   The claim is that I owe {$4300.00} to XXXX XXXX and the collection agency XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX PA XXXX, ( XXXX ) XXXX, has reported the outstanding debt to the credit bureaus.   I finished school nineteen years ago. Ive never heard of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX before now, and neither one has ever corresponded with me. How did it get in collections? Obviously neither knows a thing about me like my address or phone number. Ive had both for 6 years this Fall. How did they approve credit in my name? Isnt this disconnect obvious to Equifax?   After a few weeks they sent me a letter stating that the negative report stands. This is not my debt.   I tried to log in to the Equifax online site to address this issue, but my ID Notify Username and Password do not work there. I provided my Birthdate and my SSN to get an email reminder. Equifax sent an email to XXXX. I have NEVER had a XXXX email. So Equifax gave my info to the XXXX  and has an email address for me I have never had? I see from their attached credit report they have me as having lived in or operated businesses in XXXX and XXXX. I visited XXXX for my sons graduation from XXXX XXXX XXXX. Ive never been to XXXX. Then Equifax has the audacity to attach a negative report to my credit and refuse to amend it because the collection agency is sure it is me. Equifax cant even get my info right except what they gave the XXXX How do I prove it is not my debt if I have never heard of any of these organizations in my life? How do these credit agencies get the power to ruin ones life?   The report they sent me said I have options. I turn to your offices because to deal with Equifax has become nothing more than an exercise in futility. Please help me remove the negative and unjust report from my credit report. I have worked so hard to have good credit, and just when I need it most for an auto loan, this blow to my credit comes out of nowhere to ruin my good credit and good name.

For XXXX : the report says the account will be On Record Until : XX/XX/XXXX which would make the Date of First Delinquency XX/XX/XXXX, that is a three month difference from the date Equifax is reporting.   This type of inconsistency causes accounts to re-age and affects my credit.Any deviation from the standards outlined by FCRA Compliance jeopardizes the integrity of the data. FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) states " date of delinquency '' determines how long the debt can be reported on a consumer 's credit report and should be the first XXXX delinquency that led to the status being reported. This date should be 30 days after the Due Date with the Original creditor. If you are a debt collector furnishing information to a CRA about the accounts of a creditor, you must report the date of delinquency given to you by the creditor. FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( C ) the Furnisher has the responsibility to prevent re-aging ( inaccurately changing the date of first delinquency on a consumers account to a later date ) and duplicative reporting, particularly following portfolio acquisitions or sales, mergers, and other transfers. This account should be deleted from all three Consumer Reporting Agencies to preserve the integrity of my credit Portfolio and accurate reporting.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: To Whom It May Concern : This letter is regarding US BKPT CT IL XXXX XXXX, which is being reported to credit reporting agencies without verification. This is a formal notice that your reporting is disputed. If verified, please provide the Method of Verification.   I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please note that I am requesting validation ; that is competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) these items as reported. Please note that a report, a printout, or an employee looking at their computer screen, seeing my name listed in their database is NOT verification or validation of any alleged debt.   It is unethical not to mention illegal for you to use my information to update erroneous information provided to you. Asking for additional information is a well-documented tactic of LexisNexis. The public record and my demographic info is what is needed as per other complaints to your company.   Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including XXXX, XXXX and XXXX  ) from your company or any company that you represent, for this public record, is a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ; therefore, if you can not validate the item/items, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry.   Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take no action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports.   Failure to respond within 30 days of receipt of this letter is a violation of the FCRA and will result in small claims legal action against your company at my local venue.   You will be required to appear in a court venue local to me, to formally defend yourself. For the purposes of 15 USC 1692 et seq., this Notice has the same effect as a dispute to the validity and accuracy of the alleged bankruptcy and a dispute to the validity of your claims.   Please do not send me a letter with the contact information of the court they dont report to LexisNexis or any other agency. Since you are reporting this item it is your responsibility to validate all aspects of it.   Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: Relevant dates : XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX Dispute Nature : Falsely reporting late/missed payments for my mortgage payments Offender : XXXX XXXX XXXX I am a US Veteran and took out a VA Mortgage through XXXX XXXX back in XXXX and have always paid on time and in full without fail. I notified all my banks ( including XXXX XXXX ) and they assured me it wasn't a problem and that they could reach me via email.   In XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX stopped crediting my account because of escrow readjustments even though they were accepting my payments. They never notified me ( via email, as promised ) and instead held the money in their accounts earning interest at my expense. On top of that, they had the audacity to charge me late payments of {$430.00} despite holding onto my payments and also falsely reported my payments as missed/late to credit reporting agencies ( XXXX, Equifax, XXXX, etc ) causing my credit score to plummet by over 400 points.   It wasn't until XXXX of XXXX where they threatened to foreclose my house and seize it did they bother to contact me ( via email, as promised ). At that point I had to choice but to immediately pay the fines and bring my account back to good standing.   After everything was settled, I called XXXX XXXX and the credit reporting agencies to dispute my credit score and XXXX XXXX refused to cooperate and my credit history lies in ruin and they also refuse to reimburse me for the fraudulently charged late fees.   I am asking for your help in helping me fix this and restore my credit history back to its former good standing. Thank you. text: After reviewing my credit report, I found that my account had a medical obligation from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX for {$210.00}. I am very aware of any payments that are due and make timely payments, so I was shocked to see this account.   I do not recall any contractual relationship I had with this organization and all of my medical bills are normally paid by my insurance.   In my attempts to find out more from this organization, I found out that this company is not bonded in the state of Texas according to Section 392.101. It prohibits a third party debt collector or credit bureau from engaging in debt collection in Texas unless the third-party debt collector or credit bureau has obtained a surety bond and filed a copy of the bond with the office of the Secretary of State. XXXX XXXX XXXX state that they are associated with another company but no designation of this fact is shown in the State of Texas database. Also the company failed to provide information supporting their claim.   According to the FDCPA, the organization is to validate the debt, but I have not received the documents necessary to prove that this organization is owed the alleged obligation. I 've tried to work this situation out with the third-party collector and no information was forwarded. I needed to see an Exclamation of Benefits ( EOB ) and also a signed document showing proof of services provided to me. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX failed to provide the information but it in violation by ruining my credit by putting on my credit report an unsupported tradeline. I tried to get information from this organization via the Better Business Bureau and received no information to this date.   I request that XXXX, Equifax and XXXX remove this tradeline from my credit report as the organization in question has not provided information to support their claims of indebtedness, collection, or ownership.

text: 15 US Code 1681e states that every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. I am not satisfied with my previous dispute because I have reason to believe that this company did not follow reasonable procedures when investigating the items that I disputed on my credit report, I believe that the company 's investigation was done by an automated eOscar system which is why the investigation yielded inaccurate and false information 15 US Code 1681i ( Section 5 paragraph A ) states that Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) PROMPTLY DELETE that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. From my understanding this company could be held liable for willful noncompliance under 15 US Code 1681n especially due to the statutory and actual damages i've suffered.   The furnisher of the information is also liable under the FCRA under 15 USC 1681s-b ( 2 ) because they were notified of inaccurate and incomplete information on my report, and a proper reinvestigation was not done because the information is still inaccurate

I previously notified the company that I was invoking XXXX Form of opt out notice to consumers ; opt out methods.  As of today, the company has been evasive in complying with my notarized affidavit. My time is valuable.  And the law requires a lender to comply within ten business days after receiving this notice.  Included in this letter is a copy of the document they received on the 2nd of XXXX. Sent to their post office box via XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I have tried to deal with this matter with civility.  But this company has failed to provide a reasonable means for me to opt out. I am left with no other choice but to exercise my right under section iii ( A ) of this law. Which states The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right. And use the resources provided by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.  The law all financial institutions must abide by ; ( iii ) Unreasonable opt out means. You do not provide a reasonable means of opting out if : ( A ) The only means of opting out is for the consumer to write his or her own letter to exercise that opt out right ; So consider this my official opt out notice. This does not require a 60 day investigation.   Please be aware, the law also requires you to accept an opt out direction from the consumer. And honor the request within 10 business days. You can not require the recipient to give you any personally identifying information beyond an email address, or make the consumer take any step other than sending a reply email or visiting a single page on your website as a condition for honoring an opt-out request. This letter is not a request for a sixty day investigation. A simple compliance with my request for privacy will suffice.  And lastly, non compliance with a consumers right to privacy is subject to a civil penalty of no more than {$100000.00} for each violation.

text: Equifax experineced a data breach. Using small print they are tricking people, victims of the breach, into arbitration.This is unacceptable.   " Equifax is allowing people to sign up on its website for free identity theft protection and credit file monitoring following the disclosure Thursday of the data breach, which Equifax said was detected XXXX XXXX and affected 143 million consumers.   But the credit monitoring service, through an Equifax company called Trusted ID, has a provision that limits liability to the company, and consumers who sign up for what is billed as a free service will be charged for it after a one-year trial period if they do n't call the company to cancel their subscription.   The provisions, buried in the fine print of Trusted ID 's terms of service, added to confusion on Friday about how much help consumers are being offered. In a broader set of terms on Equifax 's website, visitors are told they must accept certain terms, including arbitration, before being permitted to register for and purchase any product from its site.   " You also agree to be bound by this agreement by using or paying for our products or taking other actions that indicate acceptance of this agreement, '' it says.   TrustedID 's terms also include this mandatory arbitration provision '' Source XXXX

text: REQUEST FOR FREE ANNUAL CREDIT REPORT!!!  I believe that each consumer reporting agency has invalidated the true spirit of the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act. The Act first  established XX/XX/2003 was intended to establish a plan whereas common American citizens could obtain a copy of their credit reports at least once a year free of charge. Since each credit reporting agency now has marketing divisions such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX  and XXXX  XXXX, the automation system to obtain the free annual reports is looped into an information request to steer citizens into additional product offers that are excessive and unnecessary. Even though I may have received an approval of an updated credit report from either XXXX XXXX XXXX or Equifax respectively, it is unfair that I need to do a mail request since I can submit my personal information through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. I believe that since the CFPB is the sole responsible oversight party of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, its imperative that any additional solicitation of information from the credit bureaus should be blocked permanently. I along with any other citizen should receive a free credit report upon request. The credit reporting agencies are an important aspect of the national banking system to properly function, but the current aggressive marketing campaign soliciting citizens for an arbitrary XXXX score has gone too far, including but not limited to XXXX XXXX We must return to a common ground that is fair for all consumers in the United States, and we must be able to request additional marketing on our own terms. Accordingly, I am making a request for a free credit report with confirmation number to my attached email address. Thank you.

text: Due to COVID 19, my XXXX  and income took a drastic casualty. We were unable to pay on personal loans for the past three months. I followed up with each of the lenders, but they simply reply saying " Any credit issues should be dealt with by the credit bureaus. '' Both companies have acknowledged that their records show I am enrolled in the programs.   The credit card companies are XXXX XXXX and Citibank.   It is my honest assumptions that this is a system glitch. However, there could very well be something on my part that I did not do, primarily due to ignorance. This has never happened to me before!   As my records will show, prior to COVID 19 I only had one missed payment in the last 9 years, which was my first credit card ever.   It is my great hope and desire that my credit history and your grace will stand in the gap for me in this instance, because I am not sure what else to do. text: XXXX My name is XXXX XXXX loan number XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX OH XXXX I was unfortunately affected by XXXX and was forced to skip my mortgage payments during the pandemic. " If your account is current and you make an agreement to make a partial payment, skip a payment, or other accommodation, then the creditor is to report to credit reporting companies that you are current on your loan or account. text: Dear Equifax : RE : XXXX XXXX A substantial injury typically takes the form of monetary harm, such as fees or costs paid by consumers because of the unfair act or practice. However, the injury does not have to be monetary. Although emotional impact and other subjective types of harm will not ordinarily amount to substantial injury, in certain circumstances emotional impacts may amount to or contribute to substantial injury. In addition, actual injury is not required ; a significant risk of concrete harm is sufficient. <P/>To determine whether an act or practice has actually misled or is likely to mislead a consumer, the totality of the circumstances is considered. Deceptive acts or practices can take the form of a representation or omission. The Bureau also looks at implied representations, including any implications that statements about the consumers debt can be supported. Ensuring that claims are supported before they are made will minimize the risk of omitting material information and/or making false statements that could mislead consumers. <P/>Furnishing certain deceptive forms " It is unlawful to design, compile, and furnish any form knowing that such form would be used to create the false belief in a consumer that a person other than the creditor of such consumer is participating in. '' 1692e False or misleading representations " Communicating or threatening to communicate to any person credit information which is known or which is known to be false, including the failure to communicate that a disputed debt is disputed ''. Sec 617 Any consumer reporting agency or user if information which is negligent in failing to comply with any requirement imposed under this title. in the case of any successful action to enforce any liability under this section the costs of the action together with reasonable attorney fees as determined by the court. Sec 611 ( c ) 1692 e. False or misleading representations " The use of any false representation or deceptive means to collect or attempt to collect any debt or to obtain information concerning a consumer ''.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: As quoted below under federal law 15 USC 1681a 2Ai any reports containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report is an exclusion in consumer reporting. A reporting of a late payment is specifically excluded under federal USC 1681a 2Ai and I want all late payments and collections deleted from my credit report immediately. XXXX and XXXX are both reporting a 30 day late payment for XXXX XXXX XXXX for XX/XX/2021, this is a FCRA violation under 15 USC 1681a 2Ai as an exclusionary reporting. Equifax and XXXX are both reporting a collections account for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX I respectively that are also in violation of FCRA 15 USC 1681a 2Ai. The law states " reports containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report is an exclusion in consumer reporting. '' These Credit reporting agencies are violating my Fair Credit Reporting Act Rights with the following : 15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction ( d ) Consumer Report.  ( 1 ) In general.The term consumer report means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumers credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumers eligibility for ( A ) credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes ; ( B ) employment purposes ; or ( C ) any other purpose authorized under section 1681b of this title.  ( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s3 of this title, any ( i ) report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumer and the person making the report ;

text: Equifax is one of the 3 major credit reporting agencies, and utilizes my information ( without my consent ) that can have a dramatic negative impact on my life. It appears they failed to protect consumer information, and, when they were hacked, executives sold off stock before even notifying the public ( insider trading? ) of what had happened. The notification that they had been hacked and that about 50 % of the adult population 's information was at risk took more than a month, which is more than enough time for identity thieves to wreak their havoc. Furthermore, to even check to see if your information had been compromised, they required agreement to an arbitration clause. Equifax 's actions are disgusting, and clearly they failed in their duty of protecting people 's identifying information. They should be disbanded, executives jailed, and we as a country seriously need to look at how much credence we give not only to our credit reports but the use of archaic SSNs which are easy to steal and thus use to destroy someone 's life.

text: I have had a Home equity loan from XXXX XXXX since XXXX ( interest only payments until XXXX ). In XXXX it converted to interest and principal payments ( the monthly payment nearly doubled ). However, after many months the modification was approved and my new monthly payment was reduced by half making it very affordable and putting my mind at ease. <P/>But here 's the problem. From XXXX of XXXX to XXXX. of XXXX the payments were getting ahead of me. I started to fall behind while waiting for the modification from XXXX to come through. When I could I would go to the local branch of XXXX and make payments of {$1000.00} dollars. In one of many phone conversations with the modification officer working my case, I mentioned making these payments. He said I did n't have to do that. He stated that any unpaid balance would be assimilated in to the modified loan. So I stopped making those payments. <P/>The modification was approved and I entered the 3 month trial payment period. Having made those trial payments on time, the final new modified loan was approved. And in deed, the previous balance was assimilated in to the new loan and the account show current. <P/>Now, here 's the rub. It seems that during the 3 month ( XXXX, XXXX and XXXX of XXXX ) trial period those payments did not go directly towards the loan balance. I 'm assuming they went in to some kind of holding account until the trial period was over. And, indeed that is what happened. But meanwhile the bank reported that not only were there late payments from XX/XX/XXXX toXX/XX/XXXXbut they also reported as late, the trial period payments ( XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX ) even though they were made on time. <P/>My credit rating has since gone downhill now. I have written to XXXX and even contacted the local XXXX branch manger to try and correct this problem. According to the Credit bureaus I 've contacted, this type of dispute has to be corrected by the bank. The bank has replied basically saying " Tough luck '' I 'm a XXXX XXXX XXXX retired Veteran. I may not have 7 years to wait for the credit report to " self '' clean the information. <P/>I 'm at a loss as to how and try to fix this problem. I WAS TOLD by the bank that I did n't have to make those payments and then they XXXX me ( and I 'm guessing a lot of others too ) by giving me a bad credit rating with no effort to fix it. <P/>I 'm at a loss!

I phoned the bank where the loan was originated and they stated that I had already signed the deal and it was too late to do anything except pay the {$460.00} each month. They told me this was necessary to protect my credit. They also told me that once I reached XXXX they would forgive the rest of the loan. I continued to pay my monthly premiums of {$460.00} for years and was never late with a payment because I wanted to protect my credit. When I reached the XXXX, the bank started to avoid me as well. They told me they were under new management and that offer no longer applied. They demanded an additional XXXX and threatened me with collections and damage to my credit. I paid for years so that my credit would not be destroyed, but now this is what I was facing. This is a criminal matter and no one wanted to help me. Based on this, I have been unable to find a place to live, get a job and this scam has literally destroyed my credit rating and my life. In addition, A CRA must block the fraudulent information and the victim must be identified within four business days after accepting his/her Identity Theft Report. When it accepts the Identity Theft Report, the CRA also must notify the furnishers of the fraudulent information that the victim has filed the Report, that the Report states that the information they furnished Resulted from identity theft, and that it is blocking the information that they furnished. FCRA 605B ( b ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( b ) .III. A. Blocking Information in Credit Reports under Sections-605B and 623 ( a ) ( 6 ) Under section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), both the credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ) and the creditors, debt collectors, and other companies that reported the identity theft-related information to the CRA ( furnishers ) are responsible for blocking fraudulent information from appearing in victims credit reports, blocking fraudulent information from appearing in victims credit reports Please let me know if you need any other information from me to block this information on my credit report. text: 3 major credit bureau companies accumulate information on you without your consent : XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ; which are used by banks, mortgage cos, car dealers, etc. : Just about everyone : They arbitrarily use some rating system along with keeping these statistics for an inordinate & obscene amount of time whether justifiable or not : This determines interest rates usually affecting the least of us in society that can afford these interests : EX : I had car repossessed by XXXX XXXX even though customer leasing for 10 yrs when I had XXXX XXXX & in hospital for 7 days : I called XXXX myself & told them I was behind a couple of months, but would pay XXXX of month. I even provided hospital phone number for verification : They chose to repossess my car from my driveway in a rainstorm : Irrelevant now, but cost me thousands to retrieve, etc. Now this is on my credit report for 7 yrs. etc. Otherwise my credit outstanding payment wise on all related finances. My point is this : How is it that consumers are subjected to the whims of these 3 major credit bureaus regardless of whether we have access to our scores accumulating all our private financial information which can affect us adversely for so many years as if we are convicted felons ; let alone what gives them the right to accumulate our private information? I committed no crime yet whenever anyone accesses my scores which are still relatively decent mid 700s on one, etc. considering the incident ; yet I am subjected to adverse interest rates because of the credit bureaus keeping questionable information for 7 yrs, etc. More importantly explain why these bureaus are able to control the financial circumstances of millions of Americans when there are so many other mitigating factors involved in the loaning of monies for mortgages, cars, loans, etc. including fact of building rapport & continuity of payments with banks, dealers, etc. than can determine their own judgement as to whether you are a viable risk> Absurd to have so many lives be charged excess interest fees & be subjected to the power of these bureaus who have accumulated your information without your consent : Class action lawsuit should be filed forcing them to stop these practices as well as legislation prohibiting these arbitrary year numbers of maintaining questionable information that are so incredibly time consuming to combat with them ; it would take you 7 years just to update your information accordingly : Do something : Congress should do something : Millions of people fall deeper in debt because of the uncontrollable usage of these 3 large firms that have tons of questionable information accumulated that is virtually impossible to combat in order to assist you when applying for credit, etc. Thank you for your time & effort : Respectfully, XXXX XXXX

text: REQUEST FOR FREE ANNUAL CREDIT REPORT!!!  I believe that each consumer reporting agency has invalidated the true spirit of the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act. The Act first established XX/XX/2003 was intended to establish a plan whereas common American citizens could obtain a copy of their credit reports at least once a year free of charge. Since each credit reporting agency now has marketing divisions such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, the automation system to obtain the free annual reports is looped into an information request to steer citizens into additional product offers that are excessive and unnecessary. Even though I may have received an approval of an updated credit report from either XXXX, XXXX XXXX or Equifax respectively, it is unfair that I need to do a mail request since I can submit my personal information through the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) portal. I believe that since the CFPB is the sole responsible oversight party of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, its imperative that any additional solicitation of information from the credit bureaus should be blocked permanently. I along with any other citizen should receive a free credit report upon request. The credit reporting agencies are an important aspect of the national banking system to properly function, but the current aggressive marketing campaign soliciting citizens for an arbitrary FICO score has gone too far, including but not limited to XXXX  XXXX. We must return to a common ground that is fair for all consumers in the United States, and we must be able to request additional marketing on our own terms. text: Wells Fargo Bank opened/authorized an individual credit card account for someone - NOT ME.  Wells Fargo Bank then started reporting this new account and it's limit/balance on that persons credit reports and they ALSO started reporting this information on my reports as well. I did not apply for this account and am not attached to it in any way, yet it is being reported on my reports that I am responsible for this account.  I contacted Wells Fargo when this was noticed years ago, and was treated like this is MY mistake, and my problem to solve.  I have repeatedly contacted Wells Fargo & the credit agencies to dispute this and have it corrected. Wells Fargo continued to state I was responsible for this account, so the agencies would not remove the incorrect information.  I most recently again contacted Wells Fargo in XX/XX/2021.  This time they admit they were wrong and " noticed inconsistencies with account information reported & would request to update their records and have the account that does not belong to you removed. '' WOW - Exactly what I had been saying from the beginning.  This incorrect reporting has negatively impacted my ability for financing approval and rates I receive. My credit score had been lowered by over 25 points, and looked like I had {$6000.00} more debt that I really actually owed.  How will Wells Fargo be held accountable for not correcting their admitted mistake in a timely manner and continuing to affect my financial stability/ability for years??  Wells Fargo should have to feel the effects of a mistake like this - I have had to.  I have numerous names and dates of Wells Fargo customer service reps and also their research and remediation analysts who were anything but understanding or helpful during this ENTIRE process, they were extremely rude and condescending, even after they admitted the bank was and has been WRONG!   Due to this format - additional documents and information will/can be provided once I am contacted. I don't want sensitive information floating around.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

This rule revises Regulation F, 12 CFR part 1006, which implements the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), to prescribe Federal rules governing the activities of debt collectors, as that term is defined in the FDCPA. The final rule addresses, among other things, communications in connection with debt collection and prohibitions on harassment or abuse, false or misleading representations, and unfair practices in debt collection.  The Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection ( Bureau ) is issuing this final rule to revise Regulation F, which implements the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and currently contains the procedures for State application for exemption from the provisions of the FDCPA. The Bureau is finalizing Federal rules governing the activities of debt collectors, as that term is defined in the FDCPA. text: I am a retired  XXXX XXXX in XXXX, California. Due to a medical condition and physical limitations, I am unable to work and my only source of income is my monthly pension.  In XXXX of XXXX, a series of unfortunate events caused me to fall behind on some of my financial obligations. I was considering bankruptcy but came across a debt resolution company online, Americor, which seemed like a better option. After a high pressure sales pitch by their representative, XXXX XXXX, I signed up and gave Americor power of attorney to negotiate my debts.  Unfortunately, my credit scores still plunged and it was difficult to make the expensive payments to Americor but I held on and trusted they would help me resolve and payoff my debts. Part of the agreement was a 25 % fee on settled accounts, which made me hesitant to sign up at first, but XXXX XXXX reassured me that it would be worth it in the long run. I was also promised a loan at 35 % interest after one year of payments to payoff any outstanding settlements. However, that loan never materialized and only offered recently in XX/XX/XXXX when I expressed displeasure with Americor 's activities. I was denied that loan.  What did materialize was an accumulation of fees, more than equal to the amounts that were going to pay off outstanding settled debts. In XX/XX/XXXX, I offered to deposit a lump sum of {$3500.00} to speed up payoffs of my open settled accounts. However, Americor aggressively insisted that the money be used as leverage to negotiate two larger outstanding accounts instead that were in pre-negotiation stages. I later found out why they chose this route, which was to continue to charge me the monthly settlement fees for Americor 's benefit, not mine.  I finally had enough with this company in XX/XX/XXXX and stopped all future payments to them. I demanded a detailed accounting records and any documentation to assist me to contact any outstanding accounts to resume payments directly to them or pay them off. I paid off all outstanding accounts except for two larger balance accounts, which ironically, I was able to easily negotiate a reasonable resolution without Americor 's assistance.  After recently reviewing the accounting records of my Americor account, and to my dismay, I realized I had paid over 77 % fees, not the contracted 25 %! This angered me even more and prompt me to file this complaint with the California DFPI and with the CFPB for Americor 's unfair and unethical financial practices.  I gave Americor an opportunity to resolve this before I filed this complaint but to date, they have not responded.  I have lots of documents to upload for your review related to this matter. Thank you for your attention and assistance in this matter. Please feel free to contact me anytime if you have any questions.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: There is an account on my credit profile from Radius Global Solutions. I have not received any goods or services from this company. I have never done any business with this company. This company has illegally obtained my Nonpublic Personal Information per 15 U.S code 6802. For example, my name, social security number, and date of birth.  Only a signed contract between I, the consumer and Radius Global Solutions would make me legally bonded to any debt that they may claim. I have never provided any wet signature or Nonpublic Personal Information to this company on any agreement.  Notice requirements Except as otherwise provided in this subchapter, a financial institution may not, directly or through any affiliate, disclose to a nonaffiliated third party any nonpublic personal information, unless such financial institution provides or has provided to the consumer a notice that complies with section 6803 of this title.  ( b ) Opt out ( 1 ) In general A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless ( A ) such financial institution clearly and conspicuously discloses to the consumer, in writing or in electronic form or other form permitted by the regulations prescribed under section 6804 of this title, that such information may be disclosed to such third party ; ( B ) the consumer is given the opportunity, before the time that such information is initially disclosed, to direct that such information not be disclosed to such third party ; and ( C ) the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option.  I have not received any debt validation notice from Radius Global Solutions as they were lawfully required to provide to I, the consumer per FDCPA laws. text: Equifax was hacked and this resulted in the disclosure of credit information including social security information for millions of persons including myself. At a minimum, the CEO, CFO and IT security people need to be FIRED, FINED heavily, and JAILED for gross incompetence. In addition, the company should be liable for any and all financial losses for all individuals whose information was stolen, and used illegally for any purpose. There is NO excuse for this at all. The databases where this information is kept must be so secure that no one individual has access to open and download the files by hacking. The personal data needs to be strongly encrypted at the source and it should require at least two valid VP level usernames and strong passwords for each to access the database files. These databases need to be virtually unbreakable. text: Duties upon notice of dispute from a consumer reporting agency Section 623 ( b ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) This section requires that whenever a person, such as a financial institution, receives a notice of dispute from a consumer reporting agency regarding the accuracy or completeness of any information the person provided to a consumer reporting agency pursuant to Section 611 ( Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy ), that person must, pursuant to Section 623 ( b ) : 1. conduct an investigation regarding the disputed information ; 2. review all relevant information the consumer reporting agency provided along with the notice ; 3. report the results of the investigation to the consumer reporting agency ; 4. if the investigation finds the information is incomplete or inaccurate, report those results to all nationwide consumer reporting agencies to which the financial institution previously provided the information ; and 5. if the disputed information is incomplete, inaccurate, or not verifiable by the person, it must promptly, for purposes of reporting to the consumer reporting agency do one of the following : a. modify the item of information. b. delete the item of information. c. permanently block the reporting of that item of information.   I requested a dispute and investigation into XXXX account that shows a balance of {$1500.00}. The account number to this account is XXXX. I have not received an update on this account. I have disputed this account as recently as XX/XX/2023 but I have not received any updates.

text: Despite the previous written requests sent to Equifax, they seem to simply ignore my appeals by not responding to my letters. The FCRA Sections 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) and 611 ( a ) ( 1 ). ( A ) requires the Credit Bureaus to verify and authenticate the accuracy of this account. Under Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Disclosures to consumers [ 15 U.S.C. 1681g ] ( ( a ) Information on file ; sources ; report recipients. Equifax shall, upon request, and subject to 610 ( a ) ( 1 ) [ 1681h ], clearly and accurately disclose to the consumer. If the consumer to whom the file relates requests that the first 5 digits of the social security number ( or similar identification number ) of the consumer not be included in the disclosure and the consumer reporting agency has received appropriate proof of the identity of the requester, the consumer reporting agency shall so truncate such number in such disclosure. & Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) Procedure in case of disputed accuracy [ 15 U.S.C. 1681i ] ( a ) Reinvestigations of Disputed Information. If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in my file at Equifax is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a creditor, the Bureaus shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the items from my file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or creditor. text: Equifax is in the regular business of assuming the role of a credit reporting agency and in the regular business of collecting the personal information of consumers. Equifax did not adequately inform me that my information was stolen. It wasn't until XXXX that I learned of an extended claims period. Between XXXX to present, Equifax has failed to report accurate information on my credit report. I have been denied credit no less than 10 times due to Equifax misreporting my personal credit information. I have had fraudulent accounts reporting on my credit report. I still have inaccurate information reporting on my credit report that Equifax refuses to delete despite numerous complaints made by me to the CFPB. Equifax consistently and negligently continues to violate my federally protected rights and state rights as a California resident. Equifax should not be allowed to do business in the US. text: It has come to my attention that XXXX XXXX has denied me of credit. text: On or about XX/XX/2023, I became apprised of the fact that there are FOUR UNAUTHORIZED inquiries on my Equifax credit report.  On XX/XX/2023 I notified Equifax of their error and demanded these unauthorized inquiries be removed.  Equifax did NOT respond within the required 30 day period.  My attorney recommended I file a formal complaint with the FTC for breach of privacy for the inquiries in question as release of my equifax information WAS NOT AUTHORIZED. I filed those reports ( FTC Complaints enclosed ) Equifax once again IGNORED the demand to remove the inquiries.  I am left with no choice but to file formal grievance with CFPB and to formally put on notice to Equifax that there are now {$2000.00} into FCRA violations.   Equifax depended solely on its flawed e-Oscar system and produced a canned boiler plate letter noting that companies can place inquiries. THIS DOES NOT COMPLY WITH THE LAW.   As in Cushman v TransUnion, Stevenson v TRW ( XXXX ), and Richardson v Fleet ( Equifax ), the courts have repeatedly ruled that the CRA could not merely " parrot '' information from creditors or collection agencies ; they have to conduct an actual, independent investigation to ensure the validity of the inquiry. Sending out a generic letter through e-oscar does NOT comply.   As Equifax is aware, each violation of the FCRA allows for damages of {$1000.00} should I take this matter to Court.  If Equifax fails to remove the noted inquiries, I reserve my right to take this matter to Court and obtain not just removal of these inquiries but also damages, court costs, and any other remedy enabled under both Federal and New Jersey law.   Be guided accordingly
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

text: In XXXX of XXXX, someone fraudulently opened a credit card account with USAA in my name and started taking cash advances. For months, I spoke to people at USAA who told me they would help but the bank made it impossible to reach anyone who actually had the power and desire to help me. text: I opened a Wells Fargo Secured Platinum Credit Card in XXXX of XXXX, where I was told that my collateral deposit of {$300.00} was in placed in an interest bearing account. Due to the death of my mother at the time I became overwhelmed with my finances and completely forgot about it. The card fell delinquent and was subsequently closed either in late XXXX or XXXX. Around that same time, I was offered a job in another country and I accepted.   Upon my return this year ( XXXX ), I ran my credit report to see why I was denied for an application I submitted, and it was then that I realized this debt had never been taken care of and I've had a charge off of {$360.00}. I immediately called Wells Fargo to discuss it. I was told that it's an accumulation of the maxed out amount of the card plus interest before it was closed. This item has remained on my report from XXXX until this day.   When I was directed to Wells Fargo Card Services to inquire as to why the {$300.00} collateral was never applied, I could not get an answer. It appears as though my deposit has vanished. On three separate occasions I have spoken to three separate representatives, all very nice, but all they can do is " escalate the issue and look into it with management. '' I have not received an answer as to why the collateral was never applied. I opened a case with the bank 's Executive Branch today and was told it would be looked into by a Case Manager. XXXX XXXX # : XXXX ) I have also disputed this particular item with XXXX  and XXXX  but there has been no resolution - they simply " update '' the account which continues to report that I owe {$360.00} on a charge off. text: It appears that XXXX, my student loan provider has reported my current loan status to credit bureaus. I noticed my credit score dropped for no reason. The only thing I believe could have impacted my score is utilizing the CARES Act and going into an emergency forbearance. However, based on Cares Act sect. 3513 loan servicers are supposed to report suspended payments to credit bureaus as if the payments have been made and NOT use any type of forbearance or deferment code. I believe some of the servicers are not reporting correctly. On XX/XX/XXXX my XXXX  score dropped by 14 points even though my balance for my student loan had dropped. After filing an investigation with XXXX  it appears that XXXX is reporting to the credit bureau that my repayment status is in forbearance. This goes against Cares Act sect. 3513 : ii ) REPORTING.Except as provided in clause ( iii ), if a furnisher makes an accommodation with respect to 1 or more payments on a credit obligation or account of a consumer, and the consumer makes the payments or is not required to make 1 or more payments pursuant to the accommodation, the furnisher shall ( I ) report the credit obligation or account as current ; or and ( d ) REPORTING TO CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES.During the period in which the Secretary suspends payments on a loan under subsection ( a ), the Secretary shall ensure that, for the purpose of reporting information about the loan to a consumer reporting agency, any payment that has been suspended is treated as if it were a regularly scheduled payment made by a borrower.   Forbearance is typically a derogatory mark on ones credit report but since this is a special forbearance it shouldn't be counted as such per the above section of the CARES Act.  According to the Cares Act sect. 3513 loan servicers are supposed to report suspended payments to credit bureaus as if the payments have been made and NOT use any type of forbearance or deferment code. I believe XXXX  is not reporting correctly. I will be filing disputes with all three credit bureaus as this has had a negative impact on my score when per legislation this should not be the case.
label: ['credit reporting or credit repair services or other personal consumer reports']

( 4 ) 15 U.S.C. 1681B ( F ). CHESTER V. PURVIS, 260 F. SUPP 2D 711 ( S.D. IND. 2003 ). I HAVE NOT INITIATED ANY TRANSACTIONS WITH ANY OF THESE COMPANIES.
